description:
Cheap authentic HK/Chinese style food. Open until very late. Their menu recently just updated to look more modern with more offerings! They have such a huge menu, and so far looks like most stuff is good. Love the pan fried noodles and chow mein. Their beef is so soft and tender. And some of their hot desserts is hard to find anywhere outside China.

Very chill place, deserves more business versus Kowloon and Creations! Only thing could use is decor makeover, their tables feel a bit sticky, and could use some more board games.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Two Sundays ago: waited for my cousin Syd to get off work.. 

Came here at like 10:30 evening with Tiff & G

I got the fish ball curry with instant noodles: bomb.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Mom and Pop's type of dessert shop.

I love how this is one of the few dessert spots in SF that is opened past midnight. The prices are relatively cheap and they have so many desserts. I do wish there were more pictures since some of the desserts like "Mango Delight" and "Mango Madness" are hard to distinguish what exactly goes in. Lots of yummy hot food dishes if you and your friends skipped dinner, etc. I got the fried bananas with ice cream and it was so good, hot crispy fried bananas with cold ice cream and some whipped cream for less than $7???? Tell me where else you could get that in SF. The only downside is that the tables are kind of sticky but besides that service is friendly, desserts and food are inexpensive and plentiful.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
3.5 stars
It's Independence Day everywhere, except for the owner and his employees. You can count on them to be open on most American holidays!

Cash only, so I ended up walking back home to pick up some $$. 
Free WiFi!
Happy hour from 2:30-5:30; sesame egg puffs and most snacks are only $3-4 range. 
Reiterating what others are saying, spacious seating for being in the avenues.
It's been many years since I've been back, the crowd has definitely changed. It's mostly older ladies and gentlemen sitting around to read their newspaper or chat haha.
author: Shannon W.

description:
This place brings back so many memories for me. I used to come here every week, sometimes twice a week. It's a great place to hang out when you're not ready to go home yet. The prices are unbeatable. They have an extensive menu that far surpasses the one at Creations (or any other dessert spot I've visited). And, in my opinion, the food is pretty good. 

The owner is awesome and I feel bad that business has slowed so much. However, that means there's always seating, so you should definitely pay this place a visit.
author: Mallory L.

description:
Cool spot we found on yelp when we were craving some late night hk style food. 
We were greeted and seated immediately and the hostess was very friendly and welcoming.
author: Kao P.

description: Food is fairly priced and has good flavor, the HK milk tea was on point and open late. My kind of place!
author: Hedilyn G.

description:
Love this place for its:
-prices 
-open late night 
-free WiFi (great for working) 
-friendly staff.

I like the waffle and add green tea ice cream! Checkout my full review here:


celiinternational.com/blog/5-best-coffeeshops-to-work-at-in-san-francisco-2018
author: Celi R.

description:
Definitely not a Tsui Wah, but pretty good HK diner food for cheap. I stopped by 2:30 today for a snack and ordered some chicken wings, toast, and a club sandwich. 

The wings were super crispy, the toast had a good balanced of butter to condensed milk, and the club sandwich was everything I expected from a club sandwich. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area looking for a snack. Keep in mind, cash only.
author: Austin W.

description:
Favorite place in town!!awesome food and desert 
Specially very friendly owner n staff,definitely my first choice of desert place!!
author: Oscar S.

description: I honestly think this is a great place to do homework and chill. The owners are nice, the place is oftentimes quiet, which is great. All the dessert and snacks are good! Cheap and good for the price!
author: Vinnesa G.

description:
[3.5 stars]

Haven't been to this place in years! Used to come here all the time in high school on Friday nights. Two of my friends hit me up last Thursday night saying they wanted to come here and I was so down. This is one of the few dessert places that stay open past midnight in the area which is nice for those late night dessert cravings. 

The place has lots of seating and I've never had to wait for a table. Back then, my go-to's were the mango madness, strawberry madness, and the egg puffs. I decided to stick with what I now and ordered the mango madness and egg puffs again because why fix something that isn't broken?

Mango madness is mango pudding topped with a scoop of mango ice cream and big mango cubes that surround the ice cream. Mango pudding wasn't overly sweet which is a good thing, the mango ice cream was a very generous scoop and mango cubes were sweet as well. If you love mango, this is the dessert choice for you! 

Now onto the egg puffs! Before when I got it, the inside was very cakey. I think they used a pancake batter. It wasn't bad but it wasn't as good as Eggettes which is still my number one place to go to for egg puffs. However when I bit into the egg puff this time, it tasted exactly like Eggettes! Omg I was so happy. Don't know what they changed about their batter but I hope they never change it again. 

Service can be kind of slow even if it is nearly empty because there's only one worker taking orders and making the cold desserts and I'm guessing only one or two workers in the back who make the hot food orders. Oh! And this place is cash only.
author: Cynthia T.

description: I'm amazed that they open so late. Good food for the price! Services could be better. Overall, positive experience.
author: Youzhu S.

description: Good food and a good place to hang out with friends. Their desserts are really worth the price esp. strawberry madness and mango madness. It's a great place to play board games and grab a bite. I give it a three star because they are not that faithful to their opening hours. Went there on a weekend in the afternoon, and they were not open. No sign or anything on the door saying they would be closed. Disappointed.
author: Laura Z.

description:
Durian run continues into My Favorite Cafe. 

Came here late night after seeing Dan B posted a photo of steamed milk custard with durian. And boy was it steaming good! Milk and durian work well together because of its creamy texture. I will rate this as my favorite hot durian desserts I've ever had. Ok, enough of my durian praise...

MFC is your typical Hong Kong style cafe serving small bite appetizers, rice/noodle dishes, blended fruit drinks, milk teas and desserts. I've yet tried the food but the watermelon drink and durian steamed milk custards were excellent. Cashier was very friendly. The place could use a renovation as the floors and green painted walls were pretty old. Will come back to try the food in the near future.
author: Stan L.

description:
My favorite cafe isn't my favorite cafe but i do love the fact that it's located so close to my house. Back in the day my sisters and I use to love coming here for late night Hong Kong desserts and we absolutely loved it! 

I came back recently with one of my sisters and the quality is still great! We love love love the steamed milk with ginger, it's always a must order! The milk is steamed to perfection with a nice gingery flavor. It's not a spicy gingery bit a slightly sweet ginger taste that pulls this flavor together! 

The next thing we love is the luncheon meat and egg sandwich, we can honestly make it at home but something about the hk style makes it better. The eggs are perfectly cooked, the spam isn't overly cooked and the crust is cut off! I don't know if they add butter to the bread but it tastes like it and it's delicious! 

The other things that I like here are their fresh fruit sago and mango/ strawberry focused desserts those are usually a good bet on being delicious. Though I don't come here as often, I still make visits from time to time and they are still just as delicious!

Total for 2 people: $28
author: Stella J.

description: Recently my favourite cafe has re-open already. I have been waiting for months for them to reopen. I love their authentic hong kong style food, snacks and dessert. Love their food. As well as their service.
author: Tammie L.

description:
After getting some sushi, I immediately started craving for some fruit so I yelped on what was nearby and I found this place. 

This area in San Francisco is filled with little mom and pop shops, hidden hole-in-the-wall's, just overall great foodie places that I've seen so far. This place wasn't amazing looking inside but the dessert we received made up for it.

I ordered their fried banana ice cream with a side of fruit. They have tons of items to choose from and traditional Chinese desserts. There weren't many people inside at the time,(probably due to the windy weather), so it didn't take too long to get our food. They have a TV planted on the wall so we watched some wrestling in Spanish. The fried banana and ice cream comes with 2 scoops of ice cream(you can choose vanilla, chocolate, green tea(?) and strawberry(?)) and it came with a mix of cantaloupe, honey dew and watermelon fruit balls. The fried bananas were delicious and not doused in heavy batter which other places tend to do. 

The service was good too. The guy who helped us out was very friendly and welcoming. :) definitely coming back for more desserts !
author: Grace Anne D.

description: This Cafe is amazing definitely get the fruite and ice cream waffle. Especially if you have the munchies q
author: Savneet S.

description:
Reasonable prices, friendly service, cash only. The snacks are pretty good.

Update: Apparently they got shut down yesterday due to health concerns which changes my review simply because these conditions are completely unacceptable and I ATE FROM HERE BEFORE. Vermin Infestation? Thank you so much to the Health Department for catching this.
author: Bernice W.

description:
Unknowingly, it really did become my favorite cafe. Just realized that I basically frequent it weekly. Really friendly family owned business.

Favorites:
- Cold lemon honey: Theirs is the best because it's a refreshing kind of sweet. I think it's a lighter honey that they use.
- Peanut butter french toast: Fluffy french toast, warmed peanut butter in between, drizzled with maple syrup
- B Jai grass jelly: Ample fruit and grass jelly with a syrup. Healthy dessert
- Happy Hour: Cheap for good portion, wide selection, happy.
author: C. C.

description:
After finishing dim sum on a Saturday afternoon, was craving for some desserts. Saw this cafe with quite high rating and decided to give it a try.

It was around 3pm and the place was almost empty. Sat down and was quickly provided menus.

#Mixed Fruits Mango Pudding: B-.
The mango pudding was not very good. Usually a good one would have soft, smooth and silky texture but the one I had was a bit hard - I don't think it was because of over frozen but it's more related to the making process I suppose. The fruit was not fresh at all. Papaya and kiwi are the ones among the most disappointed ones.

#Hong Kong Style Egg Puff: B.
Not crispy, and not hot enough. More like eating soft bread.

#Silken Milk with Ginger: B-.
For some reasons, the top layer of this dish was very nice (my roommate was even saying the dish was a 5-star), but after digging down deeper it became worse and worse. Clearly it was also a making process type of thing.

I don't think I will go back again. Question: How come I still can't find a good Hong Kong style dessert joint in SF?
author: Simon C.

description:
bootleg uno cards & fob crews at tables
dull metal spoons & forks if available
brown waffle snack dishes peanut butteray
these are a few of My Favorite Cafe

puhping puhping puhping puhping

cream colored horlicks & wtf is horlicks
funky odd desserts & napkins with toothpicks
wild foods that serve with the stuff on their plate
these are a few of My Favorite Cafe

tuhting tuhting tuhting tuhting

watermelons in slushes straws in glasses
asian smells stay on my nose & eyelashes
floating clear ice cubes that melt all the way
these are a few of My Favorite Cafe

when the teeth bites, when hanger stings
when I'm [Ea]ting [Ba]d
I simply remember My Favorite Cafe
and then I still eatttttttt sooooo baddddddd
author: Dan B.

description: Reasonable prices. The noodle soup was ok, a bit bland. The matcha/green tea shake and hoikaddo milk tea was really good. My group saw the egg puffs on the menu so we decided to order the original and the chocolate flavored one. Overall, at My Favorite Cafe, I like their drinks and desserts. The food menu could be a bit better.
author: Amy H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night after dinner looking for some desserts. The waitress was kind of slow to answer questions especially when I asked in english. My Chinese wasn't good enough to ask in Chinese hence why I stuck with English (their menu had English, too). I asked what flavors of ice cream did they have, she answered (with a little bit of difficulty), I asked is that all?, and she was kind of confused after that. 

Eventually, I ordered the fried banana which came with two scoops of ice cream, I chose green tea and mango. 
- The fried banana inside tasted delicious but the outside batter tasted more like just oil than batter. I couldn't stand eating more than half of what was given. 
- The green tea ice cream was TASTELESS and ODD. There was no green tea flavor almost, random pieces of (what I can guess) dried fruit, and tasted like freezer burn or ice cream that was melted and re-frozen multiple times. 
- Finally, the mango ice cream tasted the best out of the whole dish and I'm not even a big fan of mango! It tasted fresh, perfect level of sweetness, and refreshing. 

I'm not sure if they buy or make their own ice cream, but I'm extremely disappointed with the green tea ice cream as it is my favorite flavor. I think if I were to go back to try this place again I'd give their food and their egg puffs a try. I'll be avoiding their green tea ice cream, unfortunately. 

Note: Free hot tea on a cold winter day was very welcomed! CASH ONLY PLACE.
author: Cassy Y.

description:
The food is decent, but the ambience and service have a lot to be desired.

We came in around 4PM on a Saturday afternoon, looking for an afternoon delight/pick-me-up in the form of some tasty HK-style desserts. There were 6 of us, so they put us at a big table in the front next to the window. As soon as we sat down, everything felt... sticky. The table, the chairs, probably even the walls if we dared to touch them. After the worker placed the menus on the table, we literally had to peel them off.

We glanced through the menu and saw an assortment of delicious-sounding desserts. Steamed egg custard, steamed milk custard, sesame paste, egg puffs, blended fruit drinks. I wanted to try their milk tea pudding, but they were out. Boo. My mom wanted to try their black sesame paste, but they were also all out of that. But they had enough to make two servings of the steamed egg custard with sesame paste... wait, what? (They're also supposed to be open until midnight or so? And they're out of these staples already?) We shrugged and just let it go and ended up ordering two steamed egg custards with sesame paste, a mango smoothie, sesame egg puffs, and momo chacha (a dessert with taro chunks, yams, sago, and coconut milk).

As we waited, we began regretting the fact that we ordered pretty much all hot desserts. Even though the front door was open, there was zero air flow at the table we were seated at. And it was next to a window, so the sunshine that filtered in was magnified. It was like sitting in a greenhouse. We thought about asking to move, but that was their only large table, so we would all have to split up. It was a family outing, so... no dice on that.

The desserts came, and yeah, they were pretty good. (Except the mango smoothie... can someone say syrup overload?) We tried to eat as fast as we could so we wouldn't melt, but we also didn't want to burn our tongues on the hot food. Dilemmaaaaa. We eventually made it through, paid our bill, and rolled out. We interacted with the worker a total of six times: when she told us where to sit, when she set the menus down, when she took our order, when she gave us our bill, when she returned for the bill, and when she returned to give us the receipt. No friendly service here.

So, My Favorite Cafe? Not really. I would much rather go to one of the many other HK dessert shops in the Richmond area. The food here is decent, so I'm bumping them up to three stars, but the shoddy environment kills the good taste.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
One of the few spots that open late night Hong Kong styles food, snacks, drinks, and dessert.
Decor is a bit weird with bright lime green and yellow paint, but the space is open so you won't feel cramped.

$4.95 for instant ramen with fried egg and luncheon meat, or you can order different topping and noodle combos. Check out their specials, I tried the beef stew rice noodle (actually crepe) clay pot and it was pretty good.
author: Iris H.

description:
I have been here since my highschool days and that was over 10 years ago. I am still coming back here because I honest really like this place. My go to is always #68 which is the bead curd sweet soup with acorn and egg. This is only place that have that from what I know. But what's best about this place is that over the years less and less people came here and more tables were available. I remember in the past, there was always a wait esp on the weekends. 

Great place for small groups to talk, play board games, and eat Hong Kong style dessert.

Only thing I don't like is that when the door is left opened, misquitos come in...
author: Tiffany C.

description:
My Favorite Cafe doesn't fully live up to its name. Yes, it's a great place to hang out and catch up because of it's spacious seatings and large menu but the food isn't so great at all. 
I came here on a Friday night with my cousin and ordered the coconut milk and mango drink with aloe. My cousin got the mixed fruit with milk tea pudding. We were both unsatisfied with the food. My mango drink had a slushie consistency with very little coconut milk. The aloe didn't mix well with the drink at all. My cousin's milk tea pudding tasted really bland. I've had their chow fun before and it was alright. Suitable for a stomach filler but not too stimulating for the taste buds. 
Service was slow even though the place was more than half empty. 
Cash only! 
Come here only if the other dessert places in the area are full or if you want to hang out at a more quiet Asian dessert place.
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
Be prepared to wait if you are doing take-out. I ordered five items and it took about 15-20 minutes. The food won me over so I'm not super mad. My friends and I were very sad that Purple Kow's kitchen closed. We decided to go here for some snacks. I'm Chinese so I know my cafes very well but my Filipino friends have rarely ever been to any. 

Our Order: 
Ham and Egg Sandwich (ask for toasted)
Luncheon Meat and Egg Sandwich (not Spam)
Egg Sandwich (toasted)
Mozzarella Sticks
Potstickers

The portion size is pretty big for the price. It fed the three of us for only $22! I mean these items are pretty inexpensive so it shouldn't be more than that. Anyways, I was just really happy this place is open late. There was only one lady running the whole thing and I'm sure there was a cook in the back. I will definitely be back to dine here! I love Chinese cafes!
author: Joey C.

description: I had a nice time here. I love asain cafe / late night desert places. The waitress was really nice about refilling are drinks.
author: Seaera T.

description:
I feel like this place doesn't get enough recognition. Sure, it isn't the BEST food around town, but it's fairly decent as far as Asian desserts/munchies go. 

This is MY go-to place for a good club sandwich with fries on my lazy days. Who wants to go home from a bad day to have no food around and/or you have to cook?! 

Oh, and their oreo cookie milkshake here is yum!! Quite a while back when I was still in school (feeling old...), my classmate met me here for a snack and study session. I recommended the shake and my friend did not concentrate on anything I was trying to teach him until he was done - like, it had to be in his stomach or he'd be constantly reaching for (or eyeing) it. Lol. Oh, and maybe it was because they were not busy at the time, but they never rushed us off - pretty sure the two of us stayed for around two hours because we had a big test to study for and all we really ordered was a meal (I was starving) and a shake (he was trying it and loved it).

Yeah, yeah. Nothing stands out here THAT much, but it is pretty good in my opinion and they have ALWAYS been friendly to me - whether I was there, ordering to-go in-person or over the phone (there is now an extra $0.15 charge, but they give you a bag & napkins/utensils without even asking you), or just plain walking by. 

I live nearby and I hate how people brush them off just because nothing stands out with their food and whatnot. They are good people with pretty good food and a pleasant environment. That's all there is to it. ^-^
author: Christina L.

description: I have been going to this dessert place for many years now and I think My favorite cafe is pretty ok for a late night snack and dessert place! While it isn't some nice fancy sit down, it's cheap and spacious. I almost never have to wait, unlike many other HK dessert places in sf. The food is consistent. Nothing super creative but there are a lot of options and everything is alright. I have gotten their mango desserts and that have been good. Their milkshakes and club sandwiches taste like basic milkshake and sandwiches. Their rolled rice noodle in xo sauce is actually pretty good! The parking is ok but the service is not super attentive (but really, when is it attentive at one of these places.) If you are looking for something open late, has no line, and is consistent (but not super mind blowing) then I would recommend this place. I believe it is cash only though!
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
*Atmosphere: it looks a little run down but it is still a nice area. They have mirrors on one wall. Check yourself out every now and then. Lol. I like how they have 2 corners with a group round table. They also provide small board games which is nice when you're waiting for more people.

* Food: I ordered a mango slush bowl with mango pieces. Wish it was more flavorful as in more mango flavor but it was a bit watered down. The slush was as slushy. 

* Service: there is only one server and she always seem to be busy even though there is no one needing her. A bit confusing but she's just always in rush mode.
author: Katie P.

description:
My Favorite Cafe is not my favorite cafe.

My visit could be described in one word: Okay 

I had a difficult time navigating the menu since some of the menu items have names that don't really depict anything about what it actually is. I couldn't tell the difference between a Mango Delight vs. a Mango Madness even by looking at the picture but maybe that's just my own problem. :|

We ordered:
1. Egg puff - It was good!
2. Mango Madness - I was really disappointed by this. :( Maybe I'm too used to Creations' mango pudding but I felt this one was way too sweet and it didn't have a 'refreshing' aspect to it.
3. Fish balls + pig skin (appetizer?): I didn't try it but my boyfriend said it was really good.
4. Some sort of jelly drink with ice: I thought it was just okay but my boyfriend liked it.

Total came out to around 19 dollars. CASH ONLY - but it doesn't really bother me cause it's just like every other place that accepts cash only in SF. Creations is still my go-to late night dessert spot because I prefer the taste and it seems like they offer a wider variety of items. However, I wouldn't mind going here again since its less crowded and parking is easier to find. I'll probably just try different things next time.
author: Laverne N.

description: This is indeed My favorite cafe, best kept secret in the Bay Area for dessert. They serve a wide variety of HK style desserts and street food. And they are open till 2am!!
author: Richard C.

description:
This place is not good at all! 
We order the egg puff, pop sticker and curry balls, fry chicken with fries. All tasted bad! Seems like everything was reheated! I'm sure not coming back here
author: Stacy S.

description:
I live very closeby so this is usually the go to late night dessert place to meet friends.  it is actually one of the better one in my neighborhood.  Service is always very slow and most times need some hand waving to be tracked down.  
Dessert menu is big, everyone will find something.  consistency of flavor and texture varies, but overall a very homey taste.
author: Linda T.

description: This is actually my favorite cafe.  With tv on silent, late night hang out, plenty of room to sit and talk, endless food choices, prompt service, always pipping hot as though they just made it after you order it, tea is always at your table, love their sesame pudding.  Parking sucks.
author: Helen L.

description:
This is Grandma's favorite beef stew noodle place!  The owners are always friendly...at least in the late afternoon when I usually go pick up the noodles for my mother. The beef tendon is usually tender, and flavored with anise as she prefers.

Also recommend the chicken wings and milk shakes!
author: Gale H.

description:
This place is kinda out of the way of everything. I decide to try this place because the pictures people posted on Yelp look very good to me. 
I ordered soy sauce chicken wings, Hong Kong style egg puff and fried sweet bread. They are so........ good!!!  I usually don't like fancy flavor in my food and drinks and these items are simple but very delicious.  I definitely will be back for more.
author: W C.

description:
I'm not a big fan of most Hong Kong-style cafés and restaurants. Some of the places can be a haphazard. 

But this place is okay. The café serve appetizers, noodle and rice dishes, blended beverages and other sweet and savory treats made from fresh ingredients. 

I do like the late closing hours, which conveniently fit my frequent graveyard schedule. I was here last night (Tuesday night) for my lunch at 11:30pm and ordered #33: the Club Sandwich. For $5.95, the café's version had turkey, ham, eggs, lettuce, tomato, and bacon in three-toasted bread. I also get a pile of fries with the sandwich. This is not a http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=_BbmMSXgtyPln_6H3Yh77gbad sandwich and the price isn't bad either. Club sandwich: 

I also ordered a cup of Watermelon juice. For $3.50, the watermelon chunks is pureed into a juice. Eh...okay, but bland. The drink wasn't too exciting. My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FoOrNTlZ36XAjhoqWZWyuwexciting but did the job. Drink: 

The workers were very nice. Many of the younger patrons were having fun in the café. 

Despite being twice the age of many of the younger crowds, I do enjoy my time here.
author: Matt G.

description:
While my rating is mediocre, I will say that it is often a go-to place when my a group of us are in the area and it is late at night. The star rating is mainly for the food; they have like literally everything that you would probably find in a HK style dessert cafe, but nothing special or notable comes to mind. That said, friends and I have gotten food from chicken wings to smoothies to fries to mango to turtle jelly. Of the ones I've had, none were terrible, though none really stuck out either. Most are good as comfort food if you're just looking for a safe late night snack.

The reason this would actually qualify as one of my favorite cafes is the atmosphere. They have a TV and music going, and combined with the number of people that are usually there on weekend nights, the level of noise is sufficient to feel lively but not so much that you can't hear your own table. More importantly, they carry some cards and a few board games (like 5 sets of chinese chess) in the back for customers to freely use and play. Many memories of playing the nights away with Uno and Monopoly Deal were spent here for me.

One thing I wish they would do, on that note, is to maybe get some new sets. From what I remember, they were getting somewhat old and missing cards. But I'll keep going back as long as they keep that setting.
author: Tony D.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE. My friends and I all got food poisoning from this place. We all ordered different dishes and I guess they added a dash of stomach viruses to all of them.
author: K L.

description:
I can't say this is my favorite cafe, but it is in my top three for HK dessert in the Richmond/Sunset area.  I have been coming here for ages and I like that not much has changed.  Still don't like parking in the area though.  They still show random talk shows on the TV, are still a popular hangout for large young groups, still have so many off-menu items taped all over, have old men playing Chinese checkers loudly at night...  And they still use real ingredients for their desserts.  This place is the best if you're looking for traditional Chinese desserts. 

Lately, my favorite has been the sweet potato soup (番薯糖水) which has a heavenly amount of ginger in it.  It's got an amazing spicy punch and it's hard to find anywhere else but home that will add so much ginger into the soup.  They also use different types of sweet potatoes so you've got shades of purples, oranges, and yellows while you eat.  Recently, they've also had steamed milk custard with durian (榴蓮燉奶) and it is a bowl of steamed milk chock full of durian pieces.  Of course, if you want something more normal, the mango delight (mango pomelo sago soup, 楊枝甘露) is a great safe choice. The steamed rice noodles are the best here too.  Overall good value across the menu. 

I believe it is cash only.
author: Renee L.

description:
My Favorite Cafe is NOT MY favorite cafe...

First off... I was intrigued that they had a plethora of milk teas and Asian drinks... but then... as I looked at their menu, their food and dessert options are limited.  

FOOD: 
Ham, Egg, & Macaroni soup
Ginger "Dun Dan" (Steamed Egg Custard, ginger flavored)
Mango Tapioca

TASTE:  
-Ham, Egg, & Macaroni soup... TOO SALTY! ...couldn't finish.  :-(  ...and the pasta was wayyy overcooked.  Meh.
-Ginger "Dun Dan" (Steamed Egg Custard, ginger flavored)... TOO eggy!  :-( Sure, the flavor was nice... but Dun Dan steamed perfectly should have a light & fluffy consistency.  Steamed too long and it turns out rubbery & eggy.  
-Mango Tapioca... well, u really can't screw this one up. 

CONVENIENCE: *** [Open LATE, till midnite or 2am, depends on the day.]
AMBIANCE: ** [Wooden chairs are not comfortable.  
SERVICE: **** [Sure... the gal was fast and friendly, but too bad the food really sucks.]
PRICE:  $  [Most items are under $5, total bill was under $20.]
OVERALL: ** [2-stars... only cuz the service was decent and it's open late.]

There are plenty of other Asian cafes/dessert restos around... also open late... with MORE food options... and now I know, I'd be better off going to those places instead.
Nuff said.

[#8 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description:
It is cool here and the server was nice.  It is cheap.  It is mainly a dessert cafe with snacks.  I like it.  They have guilinggao.  I liked the steamed milk with sesame paste.
I will definitely be back here when I am in the neighborhood for a snack.  
Cash Only!
author: Lisa M.

description:
The good:

This place is great because it is open late! I picked this place at random after attending a concert since it was open until 2am on Saturday.

The food is cheap---most plates are around $7 or less. I had the pork chop egg noodles with extra egg added. It was really filling and good for a cold night. I also tried the steamed rice noodle in peanut sauce which was delicious. My friend tried one of the hot desserts and said it was just mediocre and had a weird texture to it.

You can play with their monopoly deal and uno card sets while waiting for your food.

The bad:

The only thing is that most of the food is pretty oily so if you're a health nut, don't go here. Also, it is CASH ONLY :(
author: Jenann P.

description:
Just an Okay. I guess we were a little surprised that it wasn't packed but an hour before closing on a Saturday night there were about 3 tables filled with people.

Even though we were seated all the way in the back, I was a little annoyed that they had both the front doors propped open and filling the place with second hand smoke. The tables already have laminated menus that are showing wear by curling up on the corners and stained from use. 

We ordered honeydew juice with mixed fruit and tapioca. I guess I imagined my tapioca to be like boba and was a little bit disappointed that they were the small sago balls (yeah, I know it's tapioca but I guess I had something else in mind). You can also switch it out for grass jelly. It was pretty good and nicely filled with fruit and not skimpy on it. For $5 I have no complaints and was very happy with it. We also ordered the chicken wings with fries and thought it was good too. It came with like 4-5 pieces of chicken. Besides being served hot tea, we also ordered iced lemon tea  that was delicious. I smooshed too much of the lemon in so it was tasting a bit sour and bitter but that's all on me.

Service was better than most dessert places I've been to. Unlike 100% a couple blocks away, I didn't feel like I was being given attitude or being ignored.

This place felt more like a hangout spot than a cute dessert place (like 100%). There's an old TV in the back, card games (like monopoly deal), and connect 4 game (we played it!). We only checked this place out just because we wanted to try a new dessert place but among my favorite dessert place lists, this just doesn't cut it for me.
author: Lauren K.

description: Your establishment needs to be closed down immediately. I have filed a report with the Food, Drug & Administration. My son and 7 family/friends ate at your cafe and have been food poisoned. They are vomiting, diarrhea, shivers, and body pain. You should be ashamed of serving the community. If our family and/ friends requires further medical attention, we will be seeking legal action!
author: Mari S.

description: Eating dessert here is a meal in it of itself - we had the bean curd dessert soup with the egg and the strawberry madness.  And they threw in some nutella and banana waffles.  I was really full!  Everything was really good and yummy and the service was attentive and efficient.
author: Chris L.

description:
I've been coming here for the past few years when I am in the mood for a chinese dessert. My favorite here is the red bean soup with rice balls ( I do not know what this is called on the menu, my grandmother orders for me in chinese). Also decent are the black sesame soup dumplings (tong yuen).

Its getting dirtier everytime I come, I wish they would scrub the grime off once in a while. But this place is dirt cheap for a wide selection of cafe type foods.
author: Tricia K.

description:
(See pics) Review #1204. OOO Em Gee! Best Chinese desserts I have had in San Francisco! Many had asked why I rated most similar places 3 stars. It's because I tried to compare them with those in Hong Kong.

The key of this place is not just the huge variety of desserts, but they are all prepared in scorching hot temperature. Yes, you heard me, that's the KEY for Asian food. And each one of them I tried was done extremely well.

Deep fried Chinese bun was very crispy outside and hot but not doughy inside.

Rice rolls was very soft and done just right with some firmness to it. Good they only put very little peanut sauce and separated it as a side in addition to the hot and Hoisin sauces. Very very delicious.

The steam milk custard with ginger was also steamed perfectly hot, burning tongue hot and it's so silky soft like egg white. It was also not too sweet.

The coffee with tea was also pretty good and they put good condensed milk that was not too dense and not cold so that it did not cool down the drink.

Thumbs up!

The setting is very very local and has a TV. They were playing whatever they felt like it, usually sports with friends hanging around it watching together.
author: T L.

description:
This is my no.2 latenight goto for your standard chinese dessert shop fare. They have decent ice cream dishes that can be very artistic and I will as a I like and they have a decent mango madness. 

Quick Tip: get the dessert duh!
author: Norris T.

description: i am surprised this place opened up again, but the owners are never happy. we came at dinner time, no one was there. sat down and ordered hot milk tea. no expression. 10 mins go by, nothing, more people came in.  she walks back and forth. 15 mins, nothing. we ask and she said "making it".  uh ok, it's just milk tea.  we were going to order more stuff but scared that we will be there for hours without food and having to watch the horrible reality tv dating show.  after 25 mins, we finally got up and said, milk tea to go.  she finally then went into the kitchen, grads the old looking milk tea pot and starts to make our tea. $2.60 for watery milk tea and 25 mins of our life that we will never get back. we should have just left.  she really hates being there.  needless to say, no way we are going back.
author: Silver C.

description: Love the name 'my favorite cafe' especially bringing friends who've never been and they get confused. But bottomline,  great evening snack time, late night munchies, get your curry fishball fix at a whopping over $4 price for 6 pcs. They got you for your hk style brunch items.
author: Anita L.

description:
We thought this place was good based on the reviews.  But then we showed up and there wasn't anyone here.  Despite that, I figured it's worth a shot.

The fried chicken wings were dry and bony.  The rest of the dishes were either too salty or barely acceptable.  It's certainly inexpensive, but for roughly the same price Kowloon Tong in the same area is far better.
author: Jeff L.

description: I used to come here a lot, and enjoyed the variety of its dessert offerings! Haven't gone here for a while, but I feel like the quality wasn't as what I remembered compared to other HK dessert places in the city.  My grass jelly special dessert was rather small for the price.  The glutinous rice balls filled with peanut were mediocre and had too much dough compared to filling.  Overall, a big place with tons of variety, but I feel overall food quality and service could improve.
author: Tramy V.

description:
A yummy desert place.  It's a great option and I especially love that they are open late night!!  

It'd be great it they were open over lunch time too, sometimes 1pm is too late for lunch.
author: Asa R.

description:
More like my LEAST favorite cafe. I came at around 11pm with the bf and his sister. Service was slow, even though the place wasn't even that crowded. 

I tried #44 (instant noodle dish), and oh my gosh. Way. Too. Salty. The broth is so oily too. It's a heart attack in a plate.

The bf got milk tea, and it tasted a little off. But he loved it and said it's as authentic as it gets.

I would come back though to try their other menu items. I still have hope! :)
author: Nari C.

description:
My boyfriend and I ordered a steamed milk and tofu pudding.

His pudding is ok, but my steamed milk is disgusting. It taste like green onion or some raw meat. I am not sure it is b/c they did not clean the knife or chopping board, but it makes me uncomfortable.

Essentially, their place is big and bright, and good for groups.
author: Iris F.

description:
Wow. I usually give leeway to places that are open late and all of that jazz, but this place is terrible.

My order has never been made correctly and I've been here a decent amount of times in the past ... 4 years? I gave it a few tries because it's open late & it was around the area of my highschool.

But wow, the food is nasty and I've never really said no to dessert before. It's so bad that now, when my friends go, I just sit there and drink tea. I'd rather not order from here and watch my friends eat. That's really how bad it is.

Gross. :(
author: Mel T.

description: Delicious mango pudding. Texture and flavor for a princess 彡 mango pieces are fresh. We got two waffles instead of French toast bc they were out. Tons of fruit and jellies and ice cream. Made me feel so happy *･゜ﾟ･*:.｡..｡.:*･'(*ﾟﾟ*)'･*:.｡. .｡.:*･゜ﾟ･*
author: Zelda S.

description:
#84 Mango Madness... mango pudding (with great flavor) topped with thin layer of mango sauce... diced mangoes delicately placed in that sauce, and huge scoop of mango ice cream to finish off the madness. Great.

#67 Ginger-infused steamed milk custard: A hongkie standard. Very smooth and deep ginger flavor.
author: Jana C.

description:
Because I love you yelp dwellers so much.. Let me let you in on a little secret. You may already know that My Favorite Cafe serves original eggpuffs.. But did you know they serve CHOCOLATE EGGPUFFS? (I no longer saw it on the menu when I visited, but they still make it!)

No.. It's not that flavored batter thing every other place does. It's original eggpuffs, but with a chocolate chip in each puff! 

That's not your thing? Don't worry they have a menu almost as extensive as Quickly's for you to choose from! (For those unfamiliar with Quickly's, that means over a hundred items!) 

If that didn't immediately have you running to your car to check this place out.. Don't worry, take your time cause this place is opened till 2am on Fridays and Saturdays!
author: Kennie D.

description:
Good: Big space/Classic Cantonese or Hong Kong style dessert,snack and dish/Price is fair/ Serve is OK

Bad: table and seats always greasily/ware stuff kind of dirty
author: Young L.

description: This place was my college hang out place. This was the place where we went when we didn't go to class, after the movies, after the clubs, after dinner and so much more.  Therefore, i apologize to you, My Favorite Cafe for a long long over due review.  You still make the best MoMo Cha Cha in the city.  You are generous with your portions of red bean and taro, and it's cooked perfectly right,it's soft but not to soft. It's the perfect amount of gooey-ness ( if that is even a word) . Your steamed ginger milk custard is smooth and not too sweet or too gingery.    And now you service Durian desserts!!!  I love it!! i love my steamed milk custard with durian. My two favorite things in one bowl!   If only parking wasn't such a pain in this area. This one girl that works here is always super nice! And we always get good service here.
author: Belinda C.

description:
This cafe has become to be a favorite for my sister, myself and even my kiddies. 

I love that this place stays open late, that their affordable (cheap, delicious eats in SF) and they even have HH tea time menu (everyday from 230pm-530pm). A bit of a drive if you're coming from the other side of town *we're from the Bayview District* but gas and money well spent when you're done. 

So far we're tried.. 

- Beef Stew Noodle Soup: Rice noodles, flavorful beef stew, cabbage in a plain broth. *Definitely needs a little see yao (soy sauce) than you're ready to dive in. 

- Soy Sauce Chicken Wings: Oh man those chicken wangs are tasty!! If you're a chicken wang person like myself and kiddies than be sure to grab an order or two!!

- French Fries: Bc they're simple to snack on and keeps my kiddies quiet for the time being while I'm trying to yelp!!

- Egg Puffs: Seems everyone has come here for their egg puffs and they don't disappoint either. They're fresh and piping hot.

- Warm Cola with Lemon: If you're a super Asian person, you know what I'm talking about. Yes folks, warm cola with a hint of lemon. 

- Milk Tea w/boba: Bc being a boba lover, you can't see boba on a menu and not have a try. *I still prefer Belly Good Cafe and Crepes' milk tea located in Japantown bc it's sweeter and creamier.* 

- Steamed Rice Rolls: Bc I LOVE my noodle dishes. Plain, tiny rice rolls, steamed of course accompanied with hoisin dipping sauce. Simple and yet satisfying. 

A absolute great place for late night cravings, whether you're craving a snack or dessert!
author: Anonymous P.

description: Nutella French Toast is BOMB!!!
author: Linda N.

description:
I always get thrown off by the name of this place whenever people mention it.

The food is decent, but you can find better HK dessert/cafe places in the Richmond district. I guess one advantage of this place is that it's a bit more spacious. Places like Kowloon Tong and Golden Island are super cramped, while Creations just doesn't have that many tables.

Macaroni soup noodles here are average. They throw in a bunch of random flaky things into the soup which I wasn't fond of. Soy sauce chicken wings use way more soy sauce than they need and are kinda overcooked. You can see on the plate that the soy sauce itself is really dried up. I did really enjoy the cheung fun here though. My favorite part of that dish is the peanut butter sauce, and here they just completely dump the cheung fun into a bowl of it with the other sauces on the side.
author: Allen C.

description:
I came by to get an order of sesame egg puffs to go and it was another 3.5 star experience. A huge dinner earlier had prevented me from going after their Friday and Saturday sweet tofu specials, but my egg puffs was good enough of a dessert to do the job. My egg puffs ($2.50), came with a slightly noticeable sesame flavor to compliment with a heavy eggy taste. There were some air holes but it was not as bad as the ones from Eggettes or Genki Crepes. Texture was soft and not cone or waffle-like. 

Service was decent as I was offered tea once the server realized it was taking a little long for my egg puffs to arrive. However, I wasn't quite sure why I was charged a sales tax even when my order was made to go. Still a step behind 100% Sweet Cafe but better than the other two competitors aforementioned, 3.5 stars for above average egg puffs.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I remember this place when it was an Asian bakery. And then chinese takeout. and then empty. And before that it was another bakery. Umm thats what happens when you live across the street.. This has been one of the longest opened spots in that physical location for a LONG time..  

I decided to play it safe and didn't get any fancy looking drink or dessert. I'm adventurous but not crazy and without my asian besties with me, I had no guidance. 

My strawberry milkshake came back a mango milkshake.. I wondered why it was orange... Oh well, I let it go and drank it, really good and cold but uhh super sugary and not strawberry..

My friend had a bowl of some snacky noodles covered in sesame seeds. Looked good, and tasted great! Til you get to the surprise flavoring at the end. Not quite sure how to put it but it's almost like when you have a diet soda and don't realize it til you have the chemical- like aftertaste. yay? umm nay. I liked the noodles til the last bite. Seeing as how nothing else is really open in the neighborhood anymore and we're both lazy and this place was literally 20 feet away from us both, it was a good late night choice. I'll go back if i have to, service was fine, lots of people and there was a sports recap going on but... we'll see.
author: Diana R.

description: They make one of the best French toasts and snow cabbage pork rice noodles in the Bay Area.  Worth an hour drive up from the South Bay!
author: P T.

description:
Hong Kong style cafe with a decent selection and friendly service. Their tea time specials are very good value for money.

If you are into HK style snacks, quick bowl of noodles, Chinese Ices, and desserts, this is a can't miss place.
author: Tony L.

description:
Certainly not my favorite cafe, but it's a go-to place for late night dessert.

It can get insanely crowded in here at night, but it's worth the wait.

The hot desserts are yummy; hot sesame balls in syrup. Too bad it's $3.99 for five measly balls.
Mango Madness and Strawberry Madness are really good.

This is probably irrelevant but the waitress that served us was SUPER cute! She looked like a little squirrel behind big glasses. This is not meant to be mean at all, she was just adorable.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Im a fan here. Come here for the dessert and the noodles.
Cash only!

Decent sized and bright. 

This draft was written a few years ago and decided to update 2013.

I came here last week with friends and boy am I disappointed with their noodle. Over cooked and salty. This use to literally be my favorite cafe. Now its just a dessert cafe. I would only come here for egg puffs but I can now get the at eggettes by my house.  Sorry my favorite cafe, you officially went down the hill for me and is now dropped off my list of go to desserts.
author: Julie B C.

description:
When I'm feeling blue, 
All I have to do, 
Is take a look at...

the menu at this restaurant and I'm good to go. My boyfriend and I make frequent visits when we're either wanting to have a snack or when I'm sad and need a pick-me-up. I'm a fan of the preserved veggie & pork rice noodle and the mixed fruit with coconut juice sago. Prices are reasonable, there's a large selection from savory to sweet snacks and I'm happy with the service too.

 I'm just not a fan of all the typos everywhere. I'm a stickler when it comes to spelling sometimes and it bothers me when I see fondue spelled out as fundue, chocolate as chocalate, won-ton spelled as wan-ton...and yet, they spelled marshmallow correctly. It's quite puzzling. 

Nevertheless, I like coming here and that's all I can say.
author: Carol L.

description:
My friends and I came here around 3PM, and there was only about four other people inside. There was only one waitress, and she was pretty nice. Our orders didn't take too long, but it didn't come in a flash either. My Favorite Cafe has a huge menu with over 150 different selections but with only few pictures to catch my eye. The good thing is that those pictures are really what you see, unlike those on the TV dinner boxes.

#86 Mango Delight is just another, simpler & similar version of #110 Mixed Fruit w/ Mango Juice. The only difference is #86 is $0.25 more, doesn't have extra fruit, and is a bit sour due to some citrus pulps mixed into it. Go for #110 instead; it's more worth it and is more colorful too! I should have tried the Milk Tea Pudding instead... maybe next time. They give you complimentary tea too, in a plastic cup that shouldn't be used to serve hot drinks.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Must try their steamed milk, you wont regret. The store was not very busy in early eveing. It's absolutely good for friends' hanging out. The table is a little bit sticky but their food is amazing.
author: Eva F.

description:
Definitely wanted to like this place, but I was pretty disappointed with the pudding I ordered. The milk tea pudding was super bland and not sweet at all! It did not taste anything like milk tea, and maybe had a faint tea flavour. It comes with a tiny pot of sweet milk that you can add to it, but it really did not help. Do not recommend this!! 

I also tried the egg puffs, which were good, and the cherng fun (rice noodles?) which were super yummy! I liked that they didn't have any of the dried shrimp in it, and it comes with a peanut butter dipping sauce. Yum yum. One of my friends also got a strawberry icecream/sundae dessert, which was pretty standard and really sweet. Someone else ordered ramen & wings, which were super greasy. I would probably stick with their desserts.

The service is pretty slow but it's open late!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Food was okay, but service was terrible. The waitress never came to our table unless we called her over and there were literally only four parties in the restaurant, she didn't go to anyone during their stay. No refills for water and we had to wave her down for her attention to get the check. We had the money out and all she did was walk to and from the kitchen without making any notion to look at any of her tables. Then I wanted a bag for my friend's left overs and to pay our bill, but the waitress continued to just walk around not really doing anything and just waiting at the cash register. We even tried getting her attention but she never really glanced our way... Ended up just leaving
author: Amy L.

description:
My best friend and I decided to go to a dessert cafe after our shift at work.  Our first choice was so packed and busy that we decided to find a different spot and stumbled upon this cafe.

The place looked a little bigger than our primary choice and it wasn't as busy.  The menus were laid down nicely on the tables and the women working seemed nice.

A lot of the food on the menu sounded REALLY GOOD.  I wanted to order just about everything but I resorted to the Steamed Rice Noodles, Snow Frog w/ Half a Papaya, and Fresh Strawberry Juice.

The juice was fantastic, I love strawberries and I loved that they even carry such a thing on their menu.  Steamed rice noodles always taste delicious, I love that it's served with sriracha.  And the Snow Frog w/Half Papaya was pretty good... The ice cream melts pretty fast but it's super fulfilling.

It's definitely a place we both would come back to to try out more food :D
author: Eleanor E.

description:
This is one of my default dessert places even though I rarely eat dessert whenever I go. I love the steamed rice noodles with hoisin & sesame peanut butter and the French fries. Their club sandwich and chicken sandwich are also pretty good too.

The service can be either spot-on or spotty. They are usually friendly and good with refilling tea. 

It's one of those places where you can go if you want to just chill somewhere late at night.
author: Kathy L.

description: Okay, for late night foods when everything (yes EVERYTHING else) in the area is closed, this place is a gem. But only for that convenience. Sure, it's cheap, but you truly get what you pay for. Service is slow and they do not give a crap about you. Cheap ingredients. Barely food.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I thought the french toast w/ ham and cheese was just okay. I do like their sweet dinner rolls w/ condense milk :D

Their watermelon juice is really refreshing. But if you get a mixed fruit concoction - I advise to ask for less ice. It's mainly ice and very little fruit. 

Milk tea is not that sweet, so maybe ask for sugar on the side ;)
author: Jenna L.

description:
"You should go to my favorite cafe" Ok, where is it? "My favorite cafe" I know! But where?!"  That was my reaction when my friend told me about this place.
Hmm, where should I start? I would say this place was surprisingly good a.k.a  better than I expected! :) 
We got the mango delight which has the perfect dense and sweetness...oohh yess! You heard me! Puuurrffect sweetness!! (Yupp.. I'm talking about the mangoes too!!), egg puff-- which wasn't bad at all. Soft, moist, and has the perfect crisp on the edges. Oh! And not to mention their Nutella french toast with a scoop of butter(score!), chocolate drizzle and powdered sugar on top hits the spot!!!
Their sesame paste balls are my favorite!!(make sure to drink water before you smile though. Sesame paste and your teeth are BFFs..lol) and since mozzarella sticks were phased out at Jack in the Box and McDonald's is nowhere to be found in  the area, this place actually serves good fries and mozzarella sticks. :)

However, on the negative side,  you (most of the time ) have to waive your hand to get the server's attention.  Other than that,  it's worth a try! :)
author: Gail M.

description:
This place is alright and I would only go back for the gluttonous sesame paste balls. These are so good! And they remind me of my grandma's own homemade gluttonous sesame paste balls.

Definitely coming back for the balls!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, not even close. It's so bad that they had to shamelessly name themselves "My Favorite Cafe" just so someone would actually call it that, because otherwise, those words would never come out of anyone's mouth talking about this place.

Green bean sweet soup had strange, burnt chunks in it.
Condensed milk & butter toast had too much toast, too little flavor.
Hong kong style eggs were flavorless.
Waffle w/ ice cream looked like Richard Simmons had vomited into a bowl.

If you want Chinese desserts, this is definitely not the place to go.
author: Roy C.

description:
Best Hong Kong Style Coffee Tea & Milk Tea I've had in San Francisco so far...

We stopped by in the middle of the day to grab something to drink on our walk to Golden Gate Park.  The restaurant was empty when we popped in and owner made us some fresh hot drinks... They were great.

We didn't get any food but the menu definitely hooked us for a return visit.
author: Chad M.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars
 
+ Open Late
+ Fast Service
+ Good Variety of Foods and Desserts
+ Lots of Magazines

- Rounded Tables
- Cash Only

[M] Erm... definitely not my favorite cafe... I came here with Wayne and my girlfriends the other night and found this place to be quite lively. We sat ourselves near the back while waiting for my other friends to come. One thing I found quite irritating about My Favorite Cafe was that all their tables are all rounded. It was difficult to figure out a way to sit the 5 of us~  

We weren't really in the mood to eat so Wayne and I just shared a Steamed Rice Roll and a Strawberry Madness.

[W] The Steamed Rice Rolls http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=Y69ceZI1qqDTU1Xe08oDJQ were pretty good but it could've used a little more dipping sauce on the side. It was very juicy and tasty though. 

[M] My friend suggested me to try the Strawberry Madness http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=FcO1Jd0Whoww_VvoafGpvA since she knows I like strawberries. Not the best tasting dessert ever, though I did like the ice cream on top. The jello on the bottom, however, was too "milky" so I couldn't eat it.. Other than that, the presentation was nice I suppose. 

[W] The environment is like any other Chinese dessert place. Nothing too special other than it probably had a better selection of desserts to choose from other than your regular places where people always order Eggettes and whatnot.
author: Mona C.

description:
3.5
DESSERT AND DRANK:
1.) Mango Delight
2.) Milk Tea - tasted funny


SERVICE:
Nice, but slow


ATMOSPHERE:
A verrry casual HK cafe....
author: Angela L.

description:
It was a Friday evening and we had about 12 people that just finished dinner in the Sunset.  One of the gal's suggested to get sago so we immediately thought of 20/Noreiga (Golden Island).  The big issue is Golden Island is pretty small and would take forever to sit all 12 of us, so someone suggested to go to My Favorite Cafe in the Richmond.

My friend called ahead and booked a table for 12 for 9:45pm.  When we got there there was a group waiting for a table, and I thought ohh no, our table must be gone.  I was actually wrong.  There was a table with a reserve sign for us.  I thought how awesome.

Fast forward, overall the food taste very yummy and we got what we looked for.  The price is also very good for what it is and we are totally happy with what we got.  Those are all the pluses of this place.

The downside to it is that there were only two waitresses and they were also busting.  Maybe we went on a Friday night and it was a packed house, so the food and services took rather long.  I dont blame them because there are a lot of tables to be covered and the waitresses did everything she could to serve us.

I also did not like how loud it was inside the restaurant.  What can I say:  it's a combination of Chinese people and pack house.

Overall I think i'll definitely come back again especially if you have a big group.  This place is good for what it is!
author: Marco W.

description:
Tha first time i came here, i was really excited ! I've heard about this place nd their sandwiches so I've wanted to try it out. First time, it was good nd maybe even great. But after coming several other times, this place becomes less nd less "great". Depends on your mood nd what you get.. Some of their selections are really good nd some are ok...ish. 

This place has just become a place to get some desert for around $4-5 at a really late time. Around 12 am.. I really like their smoothies, waffles with ice cream, potstickers nd sandwiches/fries ! Those are what i recommend on their menu, dont really know about tha others because i haven't really tried everything. Oh, i don't like their french toast..it reminds me of Chinese Doughnuts.
author: Michael N.

description:
3.0 Stars

Once you get seated at My Favorite Cafe you have a nice, hot cut of tea waiting for you. It's a great place to catch up with friends in a cozy, non-rushed environment. I find this placed fully packed especially on Friday and Saturday nights. My advice is to come in a little earlier to secure a seat.

My Favorite Cafe offers a wide array of HK style desserts, HK style drinks, tapioca, noodles, and sandwiches. In terms of HK style desserts you can expect to find the Steamed Egg Custard and the HK Style Egg Puff amongst other popular desserts.

The night I went I wasn't in the mood for any HK style dessert so I went with #96) Ice Cream ($2.50). I know, it's very original. It comes with two scoops and you can pick from the following flavors below. There could have been more, but these are the ones I do remember.

Strawberry
Vanilla
Chocolate
Green Tea
Mango
Coconut Pineapple

I picked Coconut Pineapple and Strawberry and the Strawberry was way better. The Coconut Pineapple had an interesting flavor that was a little tart. This could have been from the pineapple flavoring. I would have enjoyed it more if it was strictly coconut.

The service was pretty decent and the servers made sure to refill our tea cups when they were empty.

Bring that hard earned green paper, because this place is CASH only.
author: Jason H.

description:
How are you NOT eating at Pho Garden right across the street?  I'll say as long as Pho Garden is nearby this cafe, it'll take alot of convincing to eat here instead BUT I'll come here for quick dessert!  I walked in thinking it was a quickie cafe where u order and leave...wasn't expecting the tables and couches near the front; nice and chill.  :)

Tried their green tea ice cream (I dont think you can go wrong...) and my friend, more adventurous, tried the mixed fruit coffee pudding.  Not a fan...

The pudding was flavorful but texture was kinda yucky...plus the milky liquid it was in tasted like water with a hint of coffee...aka bland.  The fruit was good tho.  The menu is definately out of the ordinary.  

The lady who helped us was friendly but kinda ditsy...or maybe it's cause she couldn't understand our requests.
author: Kat C.

description:
I looked up this place thinking that since the menu had a large variety of food, it'd be worth a shot to try it out. 

When we walked in, there were two separate groups already seated. I'm not sure if it was the quiet atmosphere or the lack of service, but from the get-go, I wasn't really diggin' it. The waitress, albeit kind, didn't pay much attention to us after we seated (we relocated afterward, choosing to sit by the window-seats with the comfy chairs); instead, she went to return a jacket to the group that just recently left (brownie points for her, but we were getting impatient). It felt quite chilly in the capacious cafe. Our food took awhile to get to us too (an even longer wait). I ordered a Chicken Sandwich w/ Fries ($5.25). The plate was small, although the size of the sandwich was fair enough, I suppose. 

I'm willing to try it again because of their variety of food and desserts. I'm going to shoot for the desserts rather than the actual food next time. Hopefully the service will be up-to-par the next time I visit.
author: Vicky P.

description:
I came here last night in a group of people, and overall, I was disappointed.  It's definitely not my favorite cafe, and there are plenty more in the area that are much better.  That being said, I came when I was not very hungry and there were so items that I would like to try. 

I had hot milk tea.  It looked homogenous, but then turned out to be really bland.  When I got to the bottom, it was really sweet.  Why didn't they tell me to mix it?  It's not the sort of thing that you generally  have to mix.  My bf had mango pudding and fried chicken wings.  The mango pudding was good--better actually than the mango pudding at ETC, which was a disappointment.  The condensed milk on top, however, tasted a little off--like it was an old can that was in the fridge a little too long.  The chicken wings came with fries.  Fries were good, the wings were really bland, and not crispy enough.

If I came back, maybe I would try their beef noddle soup or their waffles, but definitely not my GO TO place.  Maybe I was just grumpy because I was cold...
author: Aly A.

description:
Took a while to cook... Whats worse is they included the tip on the bill. Really?

The food is a bit pricy for what it is... I could have just went to McDonalds.
author: Edward M.

description:
My Favorite Café

Ah... this cozy little store brings back fond memories. Nothing soothes a broken heart the way a Mango Madness does. There's just something about a mountain of mangos mixed in a bowl with ice cream and jelly that puts the soul at ease. 

Even if you happen to miss dinner because of oversleeping due to depression, this place serves a killer bacon club sandwich up until 2 A.M.! The chicken/spam ramen is also a popular choice among us young independent individuals. They also provide cool board games like Connect Four for you to play with during your stay (company not provided).

Whether you're looking for place to celebrate with fruity goodies or trying to fill an empty void over an ex-girlfriend who broke up with you because she's still in love with her ex-boyfriend after several weeks of entertaining a doomed and hopeless relationship with you, this place is family friendly for all!
author: Andrew A.

description: It's not acceptable for people inside to gambling during the day and be very loud with swear words around. I don't recommend going here for desserts.
author: cherry w.

description:
The menu is a little too extensive for my tastes, and beyond the 40 million things on it, there are also neon paper signs posted all around for even more options. I have no idea what most of the things on the menu are, but I got the feeling that if you had a little more experience with authentic (Hong Kong? Chinese?) cuisine, you could probably get them to make whatever you like. 

My meal was decent - spam, chicken wings and barbequed pork (fat, but's par for the course with HK food) over ramen noodles with a side of salty soup. I think your experience will depend fairly heavily on your ability to decipher what is available and what will be served, but if you're adventurous, you should definitely give it a go.

Also, it's very inexpensive, so that's always a plus!
author: Melissa F.

description:
Always dependable and good-for-late-night neighborhood dessert cafe! I mostly visit at night (after 9:30pm) to curb my hunger or go for a sweet treat with friends. 

Good for groups, the cafe is unassuming and not too fobby (no pink/yellow interior decorations or cutesy posters, thank goodness). 

Egg puffs, peanut butter toast, strawberry milkshakes (yum!), fries, ramen noodles (top ramen style) with spam & eggs, chicken/beef/cabbage, etc. Everything I've gotten here is delicious and cheap! 

A nice alternative to Creations and 100% Sweet Cafe! Also, just remembered that when I first moved into SF about 1.5 years ago, stopped by here and the owner welcomed me into the neighborhood with complimentary egg puffs on the house!! Yeeee!
author: Jing D.

description: Crispy chicken wings! Great hangout place to grab food, drinks or dessert and chat with friends.
author: Allen L.

description: Thank you, My Favorite Cafe.  I have been here many times but was recently reminded of why I enjoy you so much.  The environment is laid back. The staff is chill and get the job done, the food is simple but I like that it's not over complicated and I feel the prices match. The fact that they are open late night is a plus as well.  After a night of drinking or partying a hot bowl of soup, just right in size, for about $5 is a deal.  Though the soup is simple, again something I like about it, (my favorite is the instant noodle with spam and egg) it sure does hit the spot and that, I can appreciate!!! I like how you can choose the type of noodle you want for your soup.  The manfriend especially takes interest in the desserts there.  Lots of classics from growing up and when we get those cravings we are happy to get them satisfied here whether it be during the day or late night.
author: Tanyamarie A.

description:
I can never make up my mind when it comes to Chinese desserts. Black sesame paste, milk custard, egg custard, sesame dumplings, black sticky rice, grass jelly, HK-style waffle - I want them all!

This is why during my last visit to MFC I got the steamed EGG CUSTARD WITH SESAME PASTE combo. BIG MISTAKE. They serve the sesame paste at the bottom and the egg custard on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=8mfWLulw-OuRdamwIFYbFw). (I assume that they pour the egg custard mixture on top of the sesame paste and then steam the whole thing.) The sesame paste itself was actually decent but the egg custard was absolutely disgusting. Why, you ask? It was undercook and still runny in the center (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=LEihGlrvrQeSofUQHxKl0w). This would've so much better had they cooked the egg custard at the bottom first... 

I also got a HK-STYLE WAFFLE with peanut butter and condensed milk (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=9sWRf79iCpmsohQtvGwFfw). This wasn't great, but at least it was edible. The waffle itself didn't seem fresh, though they are made to order. It was hard and served at room temperature - not like the waffles I had in HK at all. There wasn't enough peanut butter but they were very generous with the condensed milk.

This was a 2-star visit, but previous visits bump my rating up to 3 stars. I know they can do better!
author: Steph L.

description:
My favorite gay things are:

Green Lantan
Light Green is so gay! Robin, Elf and Peter Pan.

THE GREEN HORNET!
The Kato suposed to be Japo but "Kay-Toh" is gay!

13 Assassins. gay! Oh yah they are. WTF?

Wear white G shock.

get a white i-phone, Oh Fxxx yes that's gay too!

having a red velvet

listen MaMa Mia.

7 Samurai

The Man From Uncle,

UFO

PETER GUNN

I was here weekday afternoon around 2:30.
It was empty.
I was the only one customer at the time.
very friendly.

I have to back there again to see other menu.
3 star for now.

Well, My most favorite gay thing is my son!
I love him very much no matter what!
author: Nobu K.

description:
I haven't been to this place that many times, only about 4 or 5 times and I usually get their mango or green tea shakes along with the nutella french toast, ramen or sandwiches. I'm not a fan of the lighting.... it secretly trips me out but every time I've come here I've had so much fun with my friends. I love saying "hey let's go to my favorite cafe!" and I really like that they're opened late. One time I made the boyfriend go out with me at 1 am just to get my green tea shake. Lumpy as it looks, it's just sooooo good. I mean, it's not diet-friendly. None of the items on the menu are. 

My first time trying the nutella french toast was an accident. I thought I read nutella toast and what I saw almost disappointed me when it was served. I HATE french toast. But I thought, "Well, nutella makes everything taste better. Let's just give it a try." I am forever going to be in love with this place for making me a believer. I'm not saying I like french toast now, but I'm not frenchtoast-phobic anymore. Yipyip!

I've never had a bad experience with the service yet. Last year me and a group of like, 12 friends came busting in at 9 PM after Lovefest and they accommodated us so well. They were very patient with us when we were ordering, and at the end when we were just horsing around and trying to figure out the bill.

If you're a normal human being, I recomment it. And for all those yelpers who gave this place a low rating, I think your expectations are too high for a DESSERT cafe. (No offense :] ) Isn't a cafe just a place to enjoy some snacks, and hang out with friends? My Favorite Cafe is a nice place to go for that purpose.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Overall not bad. The eggettes are too doughy but have decent flavor and the steamed egg with black sesame is pretty good but the steamed egg could be smoother (more egg white, less yolk) for a more refined palate.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
If they had a bit more personality and if they didn't cheat you, this would be a solid 3 star establishment.  So, my friend and I got here at 230 and wanted to check this place out.  We work a block and half away so why not?!?  

We didn't realize that they had a happy hour special from 230 to 530.  As we were ordering, we wanted to order some stuff from the HH special menu.  She goes.............No, you can't order that yet because it's not 230.  We looked at our phones and it showed 2:33.  She goes, "No, It has to be our clock."  Their clock is 15 minutes slower.  WTH?!?  Is she serious?  She was serious.  

We felt like Greg Focker, in Meet the Fockers, when he was the only one standing in line at the airport trying to board the plane.  Good lord..........I don't believe there are still people out their trying to swindle you for a couple of dollars.  I take that back..........I do know of one other owner that would.

The food, on the other hand, wasn't too bad.  It was actually pretty good.  My friend had the beef stew with udon(he said the beef stew tasted like wonton house on Noriega st), I had the deli meat(spam) with egg, and just to mess with them back, I said I would like to order a fish sandwich when your clock hits 245pm.
author: jason g.

description:
I don't understand why this place is getting such high ratings. First of all, I am not saying I'm a professional food critic, but I do have a pretty high standard when it comes to my food. I do not mean high end priced, but its all about the full package from service, atmosphere, and the quality of food.

I've been to this place every now and then over the years and each experience has been average, there were no complains and yet no praises either. From what I thought, this place would have gotten a 3 star instead of 4 (again, I'm harsh in judging). But during my last visit there, they really left me with a sour note and it made me really reconsider about going back there at all.

First of all, it was so busy there (Friday night, not unusual) that we had to wait for about an hour, not to mention we actually were there early too (about 9pm?) So the wait was not fun, although, I figured if the food was decent along with the company of my friends, it's worth the wait. WRONG! We sat down with two small tables combined and it took awhile for them to actually behind taking our orders (there were two girls working). Then it took them awhile to bring us our drinks; meanwhile, I saw them conversing behind the counters.

I ordered the black sesame paste and it was luke warm WITH lumps in it. Clearly it was powder made and not thoroughly mixed! Then my boyfriend's longan drink and he was reluctant to say anything, but I took a sip and OMG, I thought I just took a sip of whatever they squeezed out of that towel they wipe the tables down with. It was basically faucet water with longan (cut up ones, not even full). It was just disgusting so I had to say something.

I asked one of the girls over and asked them if they serve the drink with water. She looked around, confused, and said yes. I felt like she's just humoring me. I don't own a dessert cafe, but doesn't those longan fruits they use come in a can and there's usually syrup served inside? Would it REALLY be that much more less economical to just pour in those syrup to prepare for the drink? The least you can do is dilute it instead of serving it with faucet water.

I fully understand times are rough and restaurants are cutting back, but it should not downgrade the quality of food to sewage. That's just disrespectful to your customers! Maybe I came at a very bad night and the girls JUST happen to be new there and didn't know how to serve a proper drink and dessert. No matter how great of an experience I had before, ONE extremely bad experience really turns everything upside down. I just hope nobody has to eat what I had.....

-08/27/2010 Update-
Went back again because it was the few Asian dessert place that was opened during the day. The experience did not get any better, it sucked just like how I remembered it. There's no point to a wide selectable menu when half of it is not even being served.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
My Favorite Cafe is pretty low on the interior design. It looks a cheaply decorated restaurant. This place smells like a dirty mop.

The desserts are okay. Ordered the mango pudding and it tasted alright. The pudding's color is a bit faded out. Looks like it may have sat too long. The pudding taste had only a bit of mango. There was real mango chunks on top of the pudding. Overall, it was alright, but I had better.
author: Steven B.

description:
Me: Where are we going?
Friend: My Favorite Cafe!

Curious to see my friends favorite cafe we get there and I go "Ohhhh it's called My Favorite Cafe"  Yeah, Yeah, I'm sure there's ten other reviews that say the same thing but what's funny is after a frequenting the place it's literally become my favorite cafe :p

Perfect place to go when seeking a humble bite to eat at unreasonable hours. Many come here in hopes of satisfying a sweet tooth but will find the menu is copious in options and a light savory meal can come before the sweet stuff

Half the menu showcases a range of delicious pudding and icecream combinations of various fruit flavors as well as traditional chocolate & vanilla, or vanilla bean ;)

The prices are so cheap you can order 5 desserts and dry ramen with friend chicken for under $20.00 

Parking is abundant and service is swift and friendly, the owner has a big heart as you may find that he gives extra or more than the standard portion
author: Myrtle M.

description: Went there on a Wed night, and we were served well with fast and freshly prepared food. We all enjoyed ourselves.
author: Sue S.

description:
NOT my favorite cafe, but it's pretty decent.
