"First time's the worst, second time's the best." This saying can definitely apply to my experiences at this cafe. The first time was just baddd. The workers were all grumpy, sloppy, and inattentive. Maybe it was the time (1am) or maybe they were just having a bad day. Nonetheless, the service was disastrous. The food wasn't any better either.

However, they redeemed themselves the second time around. I gotta say... the rice noodles with the peanut butter sauce is dyyyyynamite. Extra hot sauce + oyster sauce on the side, and I'm good to goooo. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water, DAMN. The service was a lot better the second time around, too. They never tried to rush us to leave, and they always refilled our cups of water without us having to ask.

B+, overall.
author: Annie S.

description:
Good place with pretty good prices. Originally I didn't want to come to place due to the cheesy name, but did anyway because my friend wanted some dessert. When coming in the place was very friendly and the environment was like your typical boba cafe.

My girlfriend, friend and I all god drinks and they were surprisingly good priced ($4 or lower). We just hung out there and watched some TV. The drinks were also really good. 

I have nothing really bad to say about this place, but just the corny name. If I am ever in the area again and want some dessert I will probably stop by again.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Came here for a pre-dinner snack before we went to PPQ down the street. We probably should have come here earlier and ordered more food since it's not like you can really get full on crab. 

Steamed milk custard with sesame was good, although people said that it was better with coconut milk.

The egg puffs are also good -- nice and crispy, much better than Break Time down in Cupertino Village. 

I'll also have to try and find out what the snow frogs are next time...
author: Ted W.

description:
This place is alright.    Typical dessert place.  When I went with my friends that night, there wasn't a lot of people but half an hour later the whole place was packed!  

Parking was easy to find since we came at night, however, it would be a different story if we were to come in the afternoon/early evening.  

The servers/owners were nice.
author: Tina L.

description:
Love this place!

What an awesome discovery. Came here late at night when I was craving boba because apparently, according to yelp, this is the only place open in the whole of SF that sells boba past midnight (is that possible??.. this is SF folks, not Boise). I had the ramen dish with spam, egg, soy sauce chicken wings and little pieces of beef that normally come in beef noodle soup. Yummy! Probably super easy to make but who cares? ..and of course, I got my boba fix =)

Also, this place is really Asian'd out. Like everyone is super hipster asian (high school/college/post college crowd). I was telling a friend that at least one of us had to know someone there and 2 seconds later, I realize that the girl sitting in the table next to me was a college buddy. Small world.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Very good. We had.
LOTS OF TEA REFILLS FOR FREE.
Mango Yum Yum - fresh/refreshing
Peanut Butter Condensed Milk Sandwich - very yummy - better than PB&J
Black Rice with Warm Coconut Milk - tasted healthy in a good way
Steamed Milk Custard - reminiscent of Cream of Wheat or a hot milk to help you go to bed
and Egg Waffle - a unique texture
In a nutshell it was all very delicious AND brought me back to Taiwan.
author: Andrew K.

description: Good late night place to go and have a snack. Desserts are great and some what good for you. Really great place to go with friends. Never have to wait to be seated. Rarely gets packed. So if you want a good late night snack. This is a good place to go!!
author: Cecily H.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, I've gained such a huge burden (more like craving) to try all of the Asian dessert joints around the city. One more stop to add to the list was My Favorite Cafe.

This place was very empty when we arrived Friday evening. I'm assuming this is because most people show up in the later hours. No complaints here, that means we have the waiter's attention all to ourselves. The menu was pretty extensive and yet again I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I usually go with my gut feeling by looking at the pictures but they were so tiny (thumbnail size) and weren't so many to look at. What a bummer! I asked about the Fun Fun Mango, it seemed too daring at the time; coconut flavored ho fun noodles with mango. I eventually settled with the Mango madness and my friends had the strawberry madness. The waiter then got to work (he's the only one working at the time), I know the food was definitely worth the wait because when he came with his tray of goodies, I noticed the strawberry was sculpted so beautifully. It was indeed, edible art and tasty as well. Overall, It was decently priced for icecream, mango pudding, and real fruit ~ $5. I can see why many can call this their favorite cafe.

P.S I had no idea they served Durian (reading from past reviews), I gotta come back to try it.
author: Tina O.

description:
This place was dead when my bestie and I walked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. We got to sit anywhere we wanted because there was no one to say anything if we sat in a table for 10. ;) Menus were placed on the table already and they were sticky. 

- Instant noodle w/ curry fish balls: I thought the only thing that was curry were the fish balls not the entire bowl of soup! This dish was far too spicy for me to stomach...and I couldn't eat it. The fish balls on the other hand was not spicy nor were they curried 
- Steamed egg custard with coconut milk: mMm...this was so good and warmed my tummy. It was just the right portion too.
- Creamed soda w/ milk: My best ordered this and the girl didn't give her the milk portion of the drink. I think she only heard cream soda and tuned out the rest because we were only charged for the cream soda.

Overall the food was not bad but you would think service would be better since we were the only ones in there...it wasn't. The girl was in her own little world. We had to holler in order to get her attention.
author: Serena F.

description:
Fairly average cafe. I got a banana smoothie and it was delicious. Everything else was pretty "okay". We were mainly there because it was open late and we didn't want to wait in line.

The sesame dumplings were also pretty good but I would stay away from their fruit stuff. I was pretty unimpressed.

Also, they keep this place damn hot in the evening. I was excited to get back out into the cold. It was REALLY uncomfortable.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Went for a dessert night with the girls and instead of going to our usual place, 100% sweet cafe, we decided to give this place a try. Its a lot bigger with more seating area and has a lot more selection of food and drinks. 

I ordered some mango dessert. On the bottom it was suppose to be mango pudding but it was tasteless and hard. It has mango ice cream and a few mango chunks here and there.

My friend ordered some strawberry dessert which is suppose to be like a parfait? But it was basically like the mango hard jelly underneath with some strawberry ice cream.

As for the other foods, they had a lore more variety of snacks to choose from. They had a tv and some board games you can play.
author: Anita W.

description:
My uncanny love for durian, My Favorite Cafe hits hits the spot with 2 of my all time fav in one bowl - Durian cold tofu dessert. What's not to love? 

Sorry for breathing in your face after dessert hubby!
author: Faye H.

description:
After battling the Pho Challenge across the street and failing miserably, we were looking for a good dessert place to just relax and eat some yummy Chinese desserts. This place turned out to be exactly what we were looking for!

At first, the waitress was a bit slow taking our orders and messed up, but it happens with a large group of people. At 11pm on a Monday night, this place still had quite a good amount of customers. 

We ordered the Mango Madness, Strawberry Madness, and the Hong Kong style egg puff. The strawberry madness really was a delicious conglomerate of strawberry madness. It consisted of strawberry jello, (but not the kind you get out of a box from Safeway) covered with strawberry ice cream, pieces of strawberry and whipped cream. The mango madness was pretty similar, except it had a lot more mango pieces in it. The egg puff was pretty unique, but tasted really good for something so simple. Overall, this place was great and was very cheap as well!
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
Met some friends here last night for dessert. Its our usual dessert place. Wouldn't say its our favorite (in terms of taste) but they never rush us, we can sit/hang out/catch up with friends for as long as we like, and they'll always refill the hot tea. Which is what dessert is all about for us, especially since we don't get to see much of each other during the week anymore (post college days).

We've come here a lot over the years so we've tried our share of the menu. Nothings ever amazing but its not bad either. I always get my usual tofu  fa with mixed fruit, somebody always gets the french fries, the chicken sandwich, eggettes, ice cream waffle, ice lemon tea, etc etc. This place does get pretty busy later at night so come earlier to get a seat or be prepared to wait but its never that long.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I remember coming here when it first opened and disliked it. We were looking for a HK style dessert place and wanted to go to Golden Island Cafe but My Favorite Cafes' ratings were higher and plus it's closer to my place so I picked to come here. 

Got V.I.P parking right out front! They must know a Ms. Can't parallel park is coming and saved it for me! =) This place was packed at 11 at night on a Sunday! They table was actually ready but I had to change the amount of people in our party so it took a little longer. We got seated first while waiting and I feel like the waiters were getting pissed off cuz we were taking long. Then they probably got even more mad when we had to add another 6 to our 10 and with all the arranging and moving, people still had to sit away from the big table. But they were nice about it.

The menu was humongous! They had the usually HK style desserts and snacks like Egg puffs, waffles with ice cream, curry fish balls, sandwiches, macaroni noodles, chicken wings, steamed egg custard/pudding, fruit juices, mixed fruit with fruit juices, etc.


I ordered the:
-Strawberry Madness (around $4-5) it had strawberry jello on the bottom, whipped cream, BIG scoop of yummy strawberry ice cream, slice fresh strawberries all around and a wafer cookie on top. 
-Steamed egg pudding with sesame ($3.95) had sesame paste on the bottom steamed with HEALTHY egg custard on top. The custard was so smooth and soft and not too sweet at all. Such a healthy dessert!
-Fried Bread with sweetened condensed milk (around $4) came with 4 big pieces of mon tou, fried bread, drizzled with sweetened condensed milk with a extra side of sweetened condensed milk. I remember eating this when I was young and always loved it so I knew I had to order it when I came here. It was good but I only finished one since I ordered so much food! I wish they would not skimp and be stingy with my sweetened condensed milk though. Way better when you drench it with the milk!

Service was slow but we had 12 people in our table so it's understandable!
author: Juliane N.

description:
Huge menu with variety of hot and cold snacks & desserts and best of all, OPEN LATE!! Mostly Asian kids hanging around this place and gets crowded at night. Cheap food and makes me miss all the delicious cafes and food in Hong Kong.

It was a freezing cold night and we wanted something light and warm to eat. We got noodle soups and a sweet dessert to share. Soup was bland and noodles tasted like packaged ramen and probably were. We tried the warm taro sago dessert, which was good and not too sweet.
author: Linda C.

description:
I bet others have already thought of a joke for My Favorite Cafe, but I could not help but imagine the following conversation after I went to My Favorite Cafe last night:

Person 1: Hey, do you want to go to My Favorite Cafe?
Person 2: Sure, what's the name of the place?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: I know it's your favorite cafe, but what's the name?
Person 1: My Favorite Cafe.
Person 2: Uh?

Okay, maybe bad joke, sorry. But maybe the owners/servers get a similar joke at times?

Well, last night was my first time going to My Favorite Cafe, and I must say I rather liked it. It was actually my first time to be in the Outer Richmond part of Clement Street, and I thought it was a lot calmer/local-centric than the Inner Richmond part of Clement. The inside of the cafe/restaurant is lit with hard fluorescent bulbs, so that gives off a different feel from most "usual" cafes. Don't come here if you expect to find a "cozy, calm" place to sit and read.

I find that as I frequent more Chinese/Asian cafes, the ambience definitely differs a lot from the American POV of cafes. Inside a Chinese cafe, it's the usual hustle-bustle of a restaurant, but people can sit and chat for ages on end. The noise level can vary inside; nobody really thinks to be quiet at an Asian cafe. The atmosphere is more lively, casual, and less intimate. In some strange way, I find this all relaxing to me; it makes me really get a feeling of home.

Anyway, onto the actual review of My Favorite Cafe.

The menu at MFC is impressive; there are cafe specialties, sandwiches, noodles, hot AND cold desserts, and specialty drinks. All items are priced under $10, so one can definitely get a bargain bite at MFC. However, most of the foods are unhealthy, but...hey, sometimes it's okay to indulge.

I ordered the curry fish ball with rice noodle for my meal; The curry fish balls were tender and had a kick of spice to them. I wasn't too happy to see the noodles and fish balls swimming in greasy/fatty broth, but I had to comment to my friend Mellie P. about how MFC seemed to be a "good place to eat at to treat a hangover". Granted, I rarely ever drink until I get a hangover, but I've heard from many other peers about how greasy food is good for "sopping up" the alcohol from one's system.

Aside from the greasy brother, the meal itself was tasty and filling. Afterwards, I had dessert: sesame-filled dumplings. 5 cute mochi/rice ball dumplings in clear brother; the mochi had a good texture to it and had a hint of sweet saltiness. The servers were very generous in re-filling our cups with tea and letting Mellie P. and I sit at the cafe for 3 hours chatting.....

The clientele consisted of a mix of Asian/Asian-Americans. MFC looks like a good place for families, party-goers, and young people alike. I'd love to live near a place like this, just knowing that I could pop in at midnight and order some food/dessert from them.

I'm curious to try the "stewed snow frog" listed under both the hot and cold desserts sections. I will probably order that the next time I am back at My Favorite Cafe.

Oh, and I hate to say it, but I think "My Favorite Cafe" could very well become MY favorite cafe in the City. =P
author: Helene K.

description: cheap with good desserts.  I am not sure about the savory snacks, but this place has a good selection of desserts.  I had the steamed egg custard with ginger.  This dish is actually pretty hard to find done well and this cafe does it very well.  The customer was smooth and creamy with just enough of the ginger bite.  Nice and balanced and they served it piping hot.  Also had the taro and tapioca soup.  Again, not overpowering with sweetness, served with fresh taro chunks and again served hot.  Add to it a nice set of hot and cold beverages and you have a really nice spot for an after dinner treat.
author: Scott C.

description:
This is one of the best spots to come to if it's late, and you want some dessert or food, your choice, and mcdonald is not going to hit the spot. I usually come here late at night with friends, and theres usually a wait. Coming here late at night with friends, we're usually pretty hungry by then and if not, we still order too much. But the must haves each time would be the chicken wings, rice noodles with hoisin sauce, hot sauce and peanut sauce but I like to skip the peanut sauce. Their noodles are pretty good too if you want some noodles. I think there's a peppered beef noodle or something like that, very yummy. 

But yes, usually I come here late at night, but last night we were there kinda early kinda for a snack cause we didn't want a full on meal. Usually when we go, we're greeted by some girls, but today, we were greeted by a guy who, no offense, is much more friendly and nice compared to the girls. 

Definitely a goto spot when you don't know where else to go and you want something sweet, but you want something to eat as well.
author: Annie W.

description:
Really three stars, but their menu is extensive and has pretty much something for everyone (though sorry if you're vegetarian, as there isn't much to holla about). The "egg and luncheon meat"=spam sandwich is decent - in taste and portion size. The french fries/fried chicken item is value - as getting each separately would cost more.

The crowd is mixed age groups, but the atmosphere is geared towards the young. Not really difficult to find, but street parking leaves much to be desired.

Milestones: the first "Useful" and "Cool" votes' review! :D
author: Peter L.

description: Decors at this place are not overwhelming at all, so it's a good place to focus on conversation, especially later into the night when you just want to vent or catch up with friends.  It can be quite echo-y so you might want to choose to sit on the couches near the window.  Eggettes here are not too sweet.  The rice noodles is good for someone hungry but doesn't want get too filled at night.  I like the mango pudding here, too, even though it's right out of the fridge.  Place opens late.  During the day could be pretty empty, but at night, people come out and it can be pretty diverse group of people.
author: Janet T.

description:
Okay it's not REALLY my favorite. It might be your favorite, but it's only my mediocre favorite. It's better than Kowloon Tong, that's for freaking sure. I hate that place. I hate their craptacular service. I hate their tables. I hate their chairs. I hate their location. I hate Kowloon Tong. Did I mention how shitty their fucking service is over there? Even if you speak Chinese to them, they still treat you like shit. Don't believe me? Read everyone's reviews. 98% of them mention the horrible service. http://www.yelp.com/biz/lwHhXgzuW8yYqILkwrhxdQ

ANYWAYS.

If you ever experience Kowloon Tong, you'll understand why this place is soooo much better.
author: Susy C.

description:
Maybe it was cravings for a good midnight snack or the company but I was satisfied with my whole experience here.  My friend has come here before and said that the service wasn't great, but it must have been a lucky Saturday night because the service was pretty good, especially since we ordered things three different times.  

My group got some curry fish balls, nutella french toast, and the mango delight.  

My friend thought the curry fish balls were a little too spicy for her and ordered some ice cream, and it came ON THE HOUSE! =]  

The guy wearing glasses was actually the person who was helping us the most: taking our orders, getting us ice cream, and coming over every time we needed something.  Much more helpful than the other guy who we tried to waive down for the bill, but never came over.  

I like this place because the food's pretty good and we were in desperate need of a snack place open late.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
All my SF friends have iPhones anyways so it wasn't hard to find this late night spot for desserts after getting out of PPQ around 10pm or so. Very large menu of both sweet and savory items so it was really hard for our group to decide on what to order. I snuck some of the mango madness and strawberry madness from my friends and those were tasty. Fiance got the banana smoothie which was pretty darn delicious. I got the sesame dumplings, which reminded me of my childhood, so that was very satisfying. 

Overall, great place for late night sweets and chilling with friends.
author: Shana B.

description:
This is a typical HK dessert cafe you'll find in SF. There are a lot of options on the menu, savory and sweet. To compare with the other HK dessert cafes nearby, I would say the savory dishes at MFC are better. Other patron's plates of chicken wings and fries always catch my friend's eyes and sometimes we end up ordering a savory dish even when we were just there for dessert. 

I love how there's free wifi if you need it. Just ask the servers for the password. Also, I like how I have never felt rushed out the door, however, the service on tea refills, etc varies depending on the server you get.
author: Mindy C.

description:
UPDATE 7/29 - Changed from 3 stars to 4 stars

This place has improved a lot since I last came here a month ago. I didn't order the same things as last time, but nothing disappointed me at all this time. The portions were fair for its price and the food looked and tasted delicious. The golden sesame dumplings were so crispy on the outside, the fried chicken leg was huge, the "fun fun mango" was creative, the beer battered onion rings didn't fall apart at all, and the sweet waffle sandwich was to die for. Keep this up and it'll really be my favorite cafe.

My favorite was the sweet waffle sandwich. JONASAPPROVED!

-------------------

They finally extended their busines hours to close past midnight instead of 11pm so I decided to give it another try. A lot of the desserts/sauces seemed watered down, but the food still tasted alright. It's very loud in a Chinesey way, if that makes any sense at all. Just picture a crowded room of Chinese folks yelling at each other in Chinese. 

Soy sauce chicken wings are delicious, and you can never go wrong with steamed rice noodle rolls no matter how watered down the peanut sauce is. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Summary: Come to My Favorite Cafe if you are desperate for table space with a medium-sized group, and some members in your group are willing to sacrifice money for a meal to order unsatisfying desserts or appetizers.

Maybe we ordered the wrong items or came on a bad day, but neither of these possibilities would put My Favorite Cafe into consideration for future trips.

One of us ordered the regular, iced milk tea and thought it was the worst milk tea he had ever had.  Even the additional sweetening did not change his opinion.

The strawberry and yellow-colored vanilla ice cream that we ordered had a faint, yet unignorable taste of durian.  When we learned that durian ice cream was not even available, we could only wonder what polluted the order.

The deep fried bread balls with condensed milk was quite tasty, but at over a dollar per bite-sized piece, it was no longer tasty enough to overlook the cost.

The prices for many of their appetizers and snacks could fetch meals at other restaurants.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Hmm, I really wish we could rate with half stars because I want to say 3.5 stars. Unfortunately, it had to drop to 3 instead of up-ing it to 4. I like to joke and say that this is really my favorite cafe. Ok, well it is not, but it is a place I like to go for a late night dessert or snack. 

I've had a few things on the menu and I've always been pretty happy:
-Mango Delight: really yummy and a nice sweet treat. i am such a sucker for mango anything.
-Mango Madness: love the fact that this one has ice cream with it. i like this one more than the mango delight because it has mango chunks instead of just tapioca pudding.
-Rice Noodles: I forget what their called on the menu but they're steamed and kinda sticky. More of a dim sum like item, rather than a desert. I really like it though. It comes out piping hot and with a salty dipping sauce (hoisin i think).
-Egg Puff: One time I came here and the lady said she didn't have condensed milk. I don't think she understood us because the next time we got condensed milk with no questions asked. 

I'm sure I've tried other things, but I can't remember at the moment. They do give you complimentary hot tea. Parking sucks. Service can be okay, depending. I suggest trying it out.
author: Danielle G.

description: 2 stars for the rice noodles and the my favorite cafe tossed noodles. Everything else I've tried is MEH. The service is horrible.. They need more workers.
author: Nancy T.

description:
alright lets get down right NASTY.

hey waitress, you really gonna clip your f@^king nails?! IM OUTTA HERRRRREEEEEEE
author: Vince L.

description: Definitely not my favorite cafe. Came here with some friends for a quick bite. We ordered sandwiches which took the longest time to serve. The food was okay for what it was, but not the greatest. Cost a bit much for the food too, and included tip. The waitress was nice though but that's really the only good thing
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Definitely not my favorite cafe, but it was ok. It's just another late-night dessert place, but I don't know if I'll come back.

The service wasn't bad like some people below have said - the main guy who was in charge took care of us pretty well. 

I ordered the mango madness, which was pretty good. It was mango ice cream in a pool of mango puree which was the top layer to a mango pudding. I thought everything was really good, until I hit the pudding. It was a funny texture that I didn't really like with my ice cream and mango puree. 

My friend saw a picture of one of their desserts that was a big flavored shaved ice with fruit toppings. She was really excited about it, but when it arrived at the table, it was a disappointment. the ice was supposed to be honeydew flavored, but it was really watered down and just tasted like ice. There was very minimal fruit on it as well. Overall, that dessert was not very good.

I still prefer late night dessert places like Creations and Crepe Temptations.
author: Julia K.

description: Recently a group of buds from SJ came to SF so us SFers decided to take them to some asian dessert. The usuals are normally too small to fit 16+ people so we decided to come here. The environment wasn't super comfortable, but manageable. The workers were pleasantly shy but nice. Some people decided to grab some Uno cards and played while some people played deuces. Not everyone ordered, then they came over and broke the bad news that there was a minimum charge of $2.50 per person. The buds were disappointed so some people ordered drinks and we quickly bounced. But their "churng fun" was good, so that's a plus?
author: Linda K.

description:
My craving for ice cream changed to sago and then went back to ice cream. My friend ordered the Mango Madness(?) which I believe was mangoo puree with pieces of mango and mango ice cream. I ended up getting a banana split -- something I haven't had in a looong time. Then we split egg puffs. The banana split was pretty big and I was already full from dinner so I had trouble finishing it. The egg puffs were delicious. They were crispy on the edges which I love.

When we went, it was pretty empty. They had a TV turned to ABC so we ended up staying and watching Dancing with the Stars for a bit. My friend and I aren't really into the show, but we definitely were that night. Haha it felt like we were hanging out in my living room.

I went up to pay and I noticed there was a bowl of lollipops so I took one to enjoy as I left :).
author: Justine O.

description:
I remember I liked My Favorite Cafe when they first opened back in the day. But that really was a long time ago. The past few years, I've gone back maybe a couple times a year at most. Overall, My Favorite Cafe is your standard Hong Kong style dessert place.

But my most recent visit was not as great as before, maybe it was just an off day. Food came out really slow and overall quality seemed a little bit below normal standards. Overall, nothing really too special about My Favorite Cafe, but it is a nice place to chill with friends and to get some sago or tofu fa.
author: Angela T.

description:
Before I came here, I didn't know this place was actually called "My Favorite Cafe." My friend who we were staying with in the city kept saying "I want to take you guys to my favorite cafe!", so when we all got here and saw the sign we got a good laugh.

I tried one of their HK-style waffles with fresh fruit and strawberry & vanilla ice cream. It was pretty tasty, though the waffle was not quite what I was expecting. I prefer the liege-style waffles at Syrup in Los Angeles to this place, but this place does have a quite a bit of variety on their menu so I would definitely be open to coming back here to try something else. The service was a bit slow, but considering how busy it was when we came here I guess it was to be expected.
author: Chris C.

description: Good stuff. Not my "favorite cafe" but I like these kind of mom & pop shops.
author: Betty C.

description:
My Favorite Cafe is my favorite cafe!

When I'm hungry and when it's late at night, this is my top choice of places of going to get some snacks and desserts. Probably the only time I come here is when I am hanging out with my Asian friends, but other than that I'm rarely here. This place offers affordable snacks and desserts and a place to just talk and play card games or what not. 

Yes, why do I think this is the best in the city, it's because the variety of things you can get here is probably greater here than other places. I mean yes other places have good variety, but this is the only place that has good variety and tastes good as well. The only thing that sucks about this place is it's location. It's located all the way out in the Richmond District where there is no parking whatsoever. Yes you can drive around and get lucky, but if not, try walking 3-5 blocks. What sucks even more is that once you get to the front door of the cafe, some car leaves right in front of the place. 

Anyhow, my definite top choice in late night cafes is My Favorite Cafe hands down.  My favorite selections are posted in the picture section, but my recommendations are as follows:

- Peanut Butter French Toast
- Mixed Fruit in honey dew juice with sago
- Mango Madness
- Strawberry Madness
- Instant noodles with fried egg and spam
- Soy sauce chicken wings
author: Michael J.

description:
Skip it! Of the 100 dessert / Hong Kong style mini meal cafes on Geary / Clement (Richmond district) in SF, this one has to be the worst. The place is dirty and I'm suspecting the kitchen isn't clean either. 

Our waiter wasn't very helpful and she forgot to take down one person's order (and then he had to wait 30+ minutes for an egg custard dessert).

We ordered a few different $3.95 tea time (happy hour) noodle soups, which was pretty bad:

-beef stew w/instant ramen: the meat was decent, the instant noodle and broth was blah
- shrimp dumplings with thick rice noodle (the dumpling was obviously frozen and bland), the noodles way undercooked and still hard; the broth, like water
-the free tea is no good either

Skip it!
author: Chuck N.

description: Came here to get some work done after cafe enchante on geary closed...sat at a table at the end..ignored for 5 minutes when I was finally approached it was to be asked to move to a smaller table..that's fine. Then I see them serve those customers tea and still don't approach me at the new smaller table. Finally a guy notices I haven't ordered..when I'm asking him about 4 different items and their ingredients (I'm vegetarian) he seems annoyed and says most of the items include meat...I ask for a couple more minutes to look over the menu he tells me to write down my own order instead and walk it up. I ask for water and if you haven't noticed the trend they were rude about that also. This place is ridiculous and once I finish my paper I probably won't return ever. Save yourself the grief.
author: Liz P.

description:
As far as HK desset places go, this place is one of my favorite spots to go to as a late night option for food or desserts!

Depending on what night you go, there may be a line with sign up sheet and all. Luckily the times I've been there, there was hardly ever a wait.

Place is a little expensive as most HK dessert places but hey its late at night where else you gonna go for egg puffs?? :)

Yes i like the following items to get here:

egg puffs - delicious!
spam macaroni - the broth is just really tasty and it comes with a fried egg and spam, can't beat that
tossed noodles - this is great if you can't decide on what to get with your ramen noodles. it comes with a little bit of everything and you can add as much or as little broth as you want
mango pudding with fresh fruit - really refreshing and has bits of mango in the pudding as well so its extra yum!

I'll keep going here as I feel like this place has more room and the wait staff is more attentive then other HK dessert places.

Watch out for street parking, it may be a pain to find a good spot!
author: Christine W.

description: This place has a pretty good-sized menu for HK-style snack place, but compared to similar places on the westside (like Kowloon Tong, Golden Island, and 37 Degrees (correct name?) they don't seem too busy on a Saturday night when I came during the past week.  They had HK-style imitation shark fin soup which is what I went out (and, actually, was what got me through the door after dinner nearby).  Service was competent and friendliness was about what I'd expect for this type of place, meaning acceptable to good.
author: H K.

description:
My Favorite Cafe (Hahaha not really) is FOB-central as if it were a Chinese grocery market.  I don't have anything against FOBs (no, I lied, yes I do) but it'd be a good idea if they knew something about public etiquette and how you shouldn't smoke at the entrance of a restaurant so that the wind can blow all their second-hand smoke up into my nostrils, into my lungs and shorten my life span by half.  

It's cash only.  Who the hell carries cash anymore?  How archaic!

Customer service, as with all Asian establishments, is moot.  The waitress who brought us our complimentary tea yelled out "Watch out!"  Instead of, oh, I don't know...."excuse me?"

Last time we came here some dude was stabbed in the kitchen and ran out.  I think that's what they put in their curry fish balls - human meat.  LOL jk.  But, no really, someone was stabbed but not in the kitchen.  The smell of delinquent blood and my french fries usually don't go good together.

==========

-1 Star for lolservice
-1 Star for lolblood
-1 Star for fake UNO

*2 Stars out of 5*
author: Chris Y.

description: The dessert is forgettable but no lines and no waiting to get seat!  That sounds about perfect.
author: Byron L.

description:
There are quite a few Hong Kong style dessert places in San Francisco and this is probably one of the better ones. I've been to Creations, Kowloon Tong, that place on Taravel and that place on Noriega and My Favorite Cafe and Creations take the cake.

If you're looking for a spot to chill with friends late at night or want to grab a snack, this is the place to go (for Asian food that is).

The past few times I came here, the wait wasn't long. If you go on a weeknight, there isn't a wait. The last time I came here was a Tuesday night and we sat down right away. They have so many choices on their menu, it's ridiculous! Sure, it may be variations of the same thing, but dang, I want to order so much more than I can handle! This time I ordered the Mixed Fruits Mango Sundae and omg the mango ice cream was so good! The fruit was alright, but what can you expect? My friends order rice noodle soup and it smelled so good that I was suddenly craving salty food. But I resisted. I had some of my friend's fries and they were really good. Crispy and potatoe-y. The milkshakes are good too. This definitely isn't a place to go if you're watching your figure.

Besides the food, My Favorite Cafe is a great place to chill and talk with your friends. Or play cards. They have a TV and a bunch of magazines too. 

Overall, the food isn't fabulous but the atmosphere is great.
author: Annie C.

description:
Of all the Hong Kong cafes in the area, this one is my favorite for winter/fall.  (Creations is my favorite when mango is back in season).

Open late, never a wait, and service is generally pretty prompt.  I love their peanut paste egg waffles!  It's not on their usual menu but ask for it!  The paste is infused into the dough so it's not like you're eating chunks of peanut butter.  I'm also in love with their nutella french toast.  

But be warned that they're waffles are not like Belgium or sugar waffles.. they taste kinda chewy and almost like the egg waffles?  Not a fan.  

Their savory stuff is great too.  Much better than Kowloon Tong.  I like their house noodle that comes with a lil chicken.. a lil egg..  spam and some other stuff? 

And I rank their dun dan above Golden Island's.

But when it comes to the fresh fruit desserts.. theirs are good, but Creations is still the best.
author: Beatrice T.

description:
Came here awhile ago with some friends. I usually head over to creations or some other place for dessert but wanted to try something new so one of my friends came across this place on yelp and we decided to try it out. Upon arriving it is a restaurant surrounded by houses?  i think ? not sure i came around 12 midnight and wasn't paying attention. Service was ok nothing fascinating but nothing good to say about either. 
Ok let's talk about the food. We ordered alot, because it sounds so good. I got the fried man tao, a mango/coconut drink, a pork steak dish and something else but forgot what it was. My drink was ok it had mango and coconut so tasted the best. The fried man tao was alright as well nothing spectacular. OK now to the worst dish the pork steak one! i know i was not supposed to order a hot protein entree at a dessert place but i was hungry. It was soooo sooo bland, overcooked and DRY! I'm assuming they reheated it in the microwave and served it to me but it took pretty long for them to bring it out so not sure what they did. 
Next my friends got some kind of ginger dessert and she hated it. Very Very and i mean very Strong ginger taste that burns your throat once you try to swallow it. She told us it tasted like old ginger...that's been sitting in the shelf for years! Also the gui ling gao she had was tasteless! not even bitter nor sweet just tasteless.

Anyways MAngo+coconut aloe drink +1 star 
oh and P.S. they have very wide tables.
author: Dave Y.

description:
You know when you were a kid and you would sit around making up outrageous dessert concoctions in your head? 

Like, I'm gonna take two pieces of french toast, slather them with nutella, batter the whole thing to make it into one solid mass, and then deep fry the entire concoction! Cinnamon Toast Crunch ain't got nuthin' on my  ridiculous food combo skillz! 

The people at My Favorite Cafe have a two page menu devoted to things like this and they definitely put my dessert imagination to shame. Looking over their two page menu is an exercise in decoding a  six year olds view of what a menu should look like. Do I want something called a snow frog? I'm not entirely sure what that is and "fun fun mango " comes with a side of noodles so who knows what I'm in for if I decide to order Mango Madness? I could only hope that wind instruments would be involved in the presentation - doo doo dee doo!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I like to bring my kids to this place because it is easy to grab a table. This place used to be always full especially after dinner time. I remember that I have always need to go somewhere else because the waiting line was just unbeliveably long some years ago. Now, this place is on the downslope because of the challenge of 100% Sweet which is only a few blocks away.

Honestly, not every item in My Favorite Cafe is good. Some are really suck such as the HK Style Waffle. Firstly, the waffle itself is so chewy like plastic. The original HK style waffle should be fluffy and light. Secondly, the waffle is round in shape while the original is square. Thirdly, the filling is not the same. It should be some condensed sweeten milk, peanut butter, shredded coconut and sugar.

The sweet soups are mostly okay, not great. I have tried red bean soup, tofu soup, sesame soup and they are just okay. I would expect more and am able to find better ones elsewhere.

The ones that we love to order are egg buffs (vanilla and chocolate are good) and ice cream (2 scopes that can feed 2 kids at $2.50). Chicken wings are fine and noodles are okay, not big in portion.

We come here because of convenience and the fact that no waiting is required. Parking is a bit difficult in the neighborhood. We always need to park a few blocks away. But, it is a good gathering place for friends and we would come back again.
author: Roserrele W.

description:
You are NOT my favorite cafe.  

As I'm looking at the "cold drink" menu, I ask the worker....

Me:  "Do you have any cold taro drinks?"

Worker: "No. But we have this....."
 *points to milk tea, ovaltine and some other drinks that don't interest me..*

*I'm thinking "WTF?! I don't want that sh*t! I asked for taro!"*

Me: "Can I try the coconut milk and mango juice w/aloe, please?"

He takes my order and starts making my drink. As I'm waiting, guess what I noticed on their "Hot Dessert" menu? Taro with tapioca for $3.50. Dammit. It was already too late to change my order! Maybe next time...

Even though they didn't have taro tea w/boba, the drink I ordered filled my heart with joy. Didn't have my camera but I believe this is the same drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/VxT3LXwPdHEz1qpXeI5hig?select=CgpsYx1dwOp-YuZ9yavKYg Who would have thought mango juice and coconut milk would taste soooo good together! Every sip I took, chunks of aloe and fresh mango traveled up my straw and went inside my mouth. Man, oh man, that drink was delicious! Totally worth the $3.95!    

I've passed this place 10 billions times. Today was the first time I actually went inside. I'm glad I did because they actually have some tasty looking desserts here! They also have food! Btw, they're open til 2am on Fri-Sat. Guess where I'll be going after a night of drinking. Yup, that's right... "My Favorite Cafe" which is NOT my favorite cafe. But I'll definitely be back. =P
author: B B.

description:
Four stars for price during happy hour tea time! The service was okay. The free tea wasn't terrible, but I only took two sips. I liked the milk tea, but the boba was a bit too firm for my liking. They put a good amount in the drink though. I loved the mango pudding, but I'm a sucker for mango pudding in general. Both items were $6 with tip so I would definitely go back. 

I don't know if they have free wifi because it wasn't posted anywhere and I felt awkward asking.

I also tried the milk tea pudding.  The presentation was nice, but it had a weird taste that I wasn't taking a liking to.  I'd rather stick to the mango pudding.  And I'm not usually a thai tea person, but they make a pretty good thai tea here.  Avoid the egg and tomato sandwich though; you could make one at home that tastes the same and is far cheaper.  I mean, only putting in two slices of tomato?  Psh.
author: k h.

description:
This place is okay. Its big so seating is (almost) guaranteed on the busier nights. The food isn't really anything to write home about. The only good late-night hunger satisfier I discovered is the club sandwich with fries, though an easy entree like that is pretty hard to screw up.

Besides the space and location, I'd rather hit up 100% a few blocks away. Though I will admit the service here is better than the other dessert places, and its easier to find parking too.
author: Felix C.

description: This dessert place is a little bigger than most of the dessert joints around SF.  The snacks are good and the desserts are decent. Overall quality is ok and they open late, but I would not say its my favorite dessert spot.
author: Jennie W.

description:
My friends suggested we go here for a late Saturday night dessert.
This place was definitely busy considering it was after midnight but we were seated promptly and served quickly.
Tried the waffle with ice cream and fruit which was not bad. The dish is served with various fruits and ice cream (Strawberry and mango) on top of a asian waffle with whipped cream. 
Prices here are very cheap. Cost only $5.50 for the waffle!
Wouldn't mind returning in the future to try some other things.
Overall not bad
author: Miss H K.

description:
this is definitely not my favorite cafe.
I been here numerous times for lunch, dinner, dessert. I would recommend their ramen/noodle soups because they are good! with lots of meat too.  the Okays are egg puffs(can be too crunchy), fake shark fin soup, the cold desserts, and hot desserts.  this dessert place is alright, the service is very slow...
author: Ann L.

description: Egg puffs are good. My favorite is the peanut butter and condensed milk toast. Huge selection of snacks and drinks. Opens late. Good place to come to for a midnight snack
author: Jean V.

description:
I've only ever come here to grab take-out food.  Their sa cha beef stew noodles are actually really tasty.  I've never gotten anything else here, but those noodles just keep me coming back for more.  

I know that back when I was working really late on the weekends, I'd come in and pick up dinner at like 9 or 10 pm and the place would be packed with younger Asian people hanging about drinking boba or eating dessert.  Reminds me of the good ol' days when I used to do that when I was in high school.

Oh, and the people who work here are pretty nice.  Every time I come to order and sit at a table to wait for them to make my food, they'll pour me a glass of hot tea so I can drink while I wait.  They don't have to do this; after all, I'm just ordering to-go.  But, it's a nice gesture.
author: Loren L.

description:
I tell my friends to meet me at "My Favorite Cafe" and they always ask "oh which one?" Props to this establishment for coming up with a conveniently confusing name. I love the trashy Hong Kong magazines they stack up against the register. I also love the hilarious names like "Snow Frog" and "Fun Fun Mango"

The cafe's strength lies not in the its food, but in its niche position. I like the variety of Hong-Kong snacks offered and the low key atmosphere. Where else can you get sesame pudding and random savory snacks at 1 in the morning? Where else can you see months-old magazines featuring the Edison Chen scandal? It's my guilty pleasure dessert hangout, and I adore it.
author: Renee K.

description:
this place gets really loud. and the service can be pretty slow at times. for a party of 10, expect a 20-25 min gap between the first order arriving and the last order.

however, the dessert quality is on par or slightly better than other asian dessert shops in sf. 

order the "mo mo cha cha" dessert! think it's no. 113?
author: Ethan L.

description: I've been to this cafe so many times! I love the name. It's so cute. My friends ask me where we're getting dessert, and I'm like, My Favorite Cafe. ... Yeah, which ones your favorite cafe .... MY FAVORITE CAFE. lol. anyways i dont' really remember what i ordered in the past, but i do remember that they have good waffles and fruity desserts. i just went here last sunday and got me a thai iced tea. wasn't hungry, but it was good thai iced tea with the perfect sweetness. Really this cafe is just a good place to hang out with your friends especially when you have nothing else better to do.
author: Amy X.

description: my favorite dessert place, cause they have the hot taro sago dessert.  they also have eggettes and a long list of other snacks and desserts.  one star off for stale beans in the hot green bean dessert one time.
author: Karen L.

description:
I used to live a block away from My Favorite Cafe and never stepped foot in there until after I moved away. How ironic! It's just a typical Hong Kong dessert place that sells blended fruit drinks, sago/tapioca/glutinous rice desserts, cold or hot HK style drinks, as well as various snacks and Chinese dishes. 

It was SO packed when me and the bf arrived around 11pm (yes, it's open late all the time) but we were able to snag the last free table in the room. Service was incredibly slow and the workers didn't attempt to move if we just made eye contact with them, we had to wave them down before we received any attention. I know they were busy but that still doesn't excuse the fact that they were negligent. 

Here's what we ordered:

hong kong style egg puffs - These were just OK. They were kinda cold when they came out and most of the egg puffs were hollow...I like them more doughy. At least they tasted pretty good with a hint of sweetness and crunch.

strawberry madness - I only sampled this one but I liked it because I normally love strawberries. It was pretty much strawberry flavored jello topped with strawberry ice cream, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream. Can't forget the cigar cookie too! It all went well together but nothing you can't make at home.

It came out to being around $7-8. Cash only of course and warning that it gets busy late night on the weekends. I'm willing to give it another shot when it's not so bustling though.
author: Karen Y.

description:
This really IS my favorite cafe.  My ex called it "My Least Favorite Cafe."  I saw that as A Sign.

Hooray for cheap, cheap food.  Of course, stay away from the ones that look too ordinary, and you're good to go.  Excellent potstickers, desserts and drinks.

The only downside is that they're cash only (are you guys noticing a trend here?) and they charge extra for to-go.  What??  Cheeeaaap.
author: Tori S.

description: Used to come here all the time with friends after work for a late night dinner/snack. Their ramen is pretty good, especially the one with the chicken wings, egg, and spam (I don't remember the name of it). Drinks aren't too bad either, and definitely try the glutenous rice balls. However, I'm not much of a fan of their aloe drinks.
author: Leslie C.

description:
If I can give it zero stars, I would.

I stopped coming here because the service is TERRIBLE! I remember one time my friend ordered egg puffs and it hadn't come yet so we asked the waitress, and she finally told us that they were out of flour. WTF?! Now you tell us? And everytime I go there, we wait a whole hour for all the food to come. The food's not that great too. Fucking ridiculous...
author: Vivian L.

description:
Came here tonight with a few girlfriends. Its a weds night so it wasn't very busy at all - in fact there was only one other table when I got here. Another table came in while we were there..overall not busy on a weeknight at all. We come here because its a decent place to come to have Asian dessert to catch up on each others lives. 

We always ordered the eggettes to share. Normally it comes out nice and crunchy, but tonight it came out kinda soft and mushy..we always ask for a side of condensed milk to dip it in. And they always just give it to us with no problem. We also ordered the sesame balls in sweet soup - and that was pretty good. I ordered the taro tapioca, and it wasn't too sweet and it wasn't bland at all....I really liked this. We also ordered the deep fried sweet bread which was surprisingly pretty good. Its served with condensed milk. We also ordered the coconut milk in black sticky rice - and that came out kinda funny. The milk didn't taste like coconut milk at all...and when we told them that..they brought us some more coconut milk in its own cup, and it tasted a little spoiled. So they were nice enough to take the dessert away and asked if we wanted something else. We got a hot lemon tea. 

Overall, they have a lot of hk style desserts here. And if you have the munchies- they have sandwiches and ramen (probably instant) to eat. Everything here is cheap (around $2.50 - $6) and pretty decent. The space is pretty big and you should be able to get a seat on a weekday. I've been here on the weekends before as well and it can get packed. Overall, its not a bad place that stays open late to come and grab a dessert from.
author: Betty S.

description:
Came here hoping to get the free eggpuffs that I got from a website, but they ran out ! How do you run out of eggpuffs? Anyways, waitress was nice enough to let me choose another appetizer free of charge.

Friend and I both ordered the Deep fried sweet bread with condense milk sauce. GOOOD GOOD GOOOD stuff. Food came out freshly made and wasn't fried too much. Only problem is, it costs $3.95 for 4 pieces of small bread. 

Other friend ordered the nutella french toast. Order came decent size for the price. Must eat it hot though, because if you wait and eat it cold, it's just flat out nasty. ($3.95)

Why only 3 stars? Service was rather lacking even though there were nobody at the restaurant, and the atmosphere wasn't really appealing. 

P.S: They still charge 9.5% tax! Last time I check, tax is now 8.5%
author: Garrick L.

description:
Def. not a bad place for chinese desserts.  There are always plenty of selections.  And I think people tend to forget about their savory menu which is surprisingly good.  Their instant noodle specials are actually pretty good.  
Cash only though and parking def. is tough out here in the Richmond.
author: AhLin C.

description:
I love late night dining, especially if it's sweets! I had a huge craving for desserts last Saturday night and off we went to My Favorite Cafe! I thought this name was pretty conceited and I was ready to prove them wrong (or right). We walked in and it wasn't crowded, just two other groups of people. Immediately I noticed the awkward dim lighting and messy tables. I would think since it's not that crowded, they would try to clean up a bit. We sat down at the least dirtiest table since no one told us where to sit. A server girl came to wipe it down and got crumbs on me. =/ All I thought was, food better be good! 

Milk Tea Pudding - I saw a delicious looking picture of this on yelp so I already knew I was going to order this. I love milk tea! And I love pudding. But I barely even liked this dish. It was very bland, tasted like no flavor jello but with the slightest hint of tea. The condensed milk and chocolate shavings on top was a good effort but that ran out quick. 

Mixed Fruit with Tapicoa and Mango Juice - This was much better. The mango juice was very sugary but had a nice, thick mango puree consistency. Tapioca and fruit is usually a good combo. 

Onion Rings - This was run of the mill and was a small portion served on a tiny plate. I'd say maybe seven rings? They didn't even offer us ketchup. 

There are a lot of other places I want to try so I doubt I'll be back here again. I do recommend coming here or to any dessert cafes with a bigger group so you can try more things without looking like a total fatty.
author: Julia T.

description:
We had an early lunch, and so were craving a light dinner with dessert. Looking for something nearby, we opted for My Favorite Cafe to satisfy our dinner and sweet tooth craving.

For the food during our visit, we ordered the chicken sandwich (includes fries) and sesame dumplings. The chicken sandwich tasted a bit like the chicken burgers one can get at Burger King... except with bread rather than a bun. That's nothing bad, but worth noting. At $5, it was a good value. The sesame dumplings were also good, and a nice warm dessert.

Overall, we have nothing particularly bad to say about this place. It wasn't great, but is still okay, might even deserve a "high 3". Overall, we probably won't be back, but if we lived right next door we might frequent this place more often as a late night dessert hub.
author: Sami R.

description: Won ton was the worst for the last 10 years i have ever tried. And they wanted to charge $8. In menu it is for 3.95. Not cheap, not good.
author: Cruel M.

description:
Nothing more pleasant than four guys walking into a place called My Favorite Cafe in the middle of a Sunday Afternoon after Dim Sum making a ruckus at the place while watchin the AFC/NFC pro bowl and talking about girls and about their feet then sipping on our spoon of milk custard.

yes..that pretty much paints a picture.  this place is opened almost everyday all day and i'm glad for that.  because its establishments like these which I'm very happy for being so close to my house that I can count on to have these congregations with my boys and talk about whether we'd do Jessica Alba if she had herpes.  

Anyways, iv'e been coming here for years just probably every other month.  But they do deliver with their fruit and ice cream over waffles, sesame paste, egg puffs, and my new favorite, milk custard.  Egg custard is not so great.  

and yes.  I would.....
author: Vincent K.

description: This is your typical Hong Kong style dessert/late night snack place. I have been here a few times. It nice as it close to where I live but there isn't a whole lot of parking in this area. I generally have a strawberry sago or ice cream sundae. It's not the best and not the worst. I come when friends suggest it. I prefer other HK places in the neighborhood instead.
author: Annie P.

description:
I came in on a Tuesday night with a few friends around 10:30pm and the place was packed. I wanted to go to a new dessert place since we always go to Golden Island, Creations, or Kowloon Tong Dessert. 

Since it was a cold rainy night I wanted to get something hot. The menu was huge. They had cold dessert selections such as ice cream and the regular watermelon juice with sago and mixed fruits. Hot desserts such as hot red bean soup (which i got) and dun don. They also have specialty desserts such as mango with flat rice noodles which I thought was kind of weird. They also have milk tea pudding which sounded pretty good but I needed something HOT. Everything on the menu was mostly under $4-5. 

They also had cake choices and that night they had tiramisu and cheesecake. There was an atomic ice cream bowl or something and our guy friends HAD to order that for the girls. It came with a scoop of green tea ice cream, chocolate, strawberry, mango, and I think the last was vanilla. We totally couldn't finish that. It was TOO big and too much. Even the guys couldn't finish the rest. Everything was pretty okay. Nothing really to wow about but then again I'm not really a big fan of Asian desserts. Probably a good place to just sit and have dessert with a couple of friends. You know those kind of places where you can sit and have long conversations and catch up with one another. 

**Note: There's a sign near the register that says they charge 10 cents for a to-go box.**
author: Tracy A.

description:
I call this place my favorite cafe for two reasons: 
1. I live 2 blocks away.
2. They make the best egg puffs hands down.
3 (bonus). They are open late.
I don't know what magical substance they use, but they egg puff comes out perfect - chewy, hot , moist deliciousness. Ever tried Genki crepes on clement? Their egg puff tastes like flimsyass fortune cookies. BLAH.
Anyhow, I digress. Back to MFC, (sounds pretty badass doesn't it?) thw employees are very nice too. I remember going there around 2 am right before closing, and they didn't give me the stink eye when I wanted to order. 
Aside from some disturbingly bad sounding things they have on the menu like snow fungus and frogs and momochacha or whatnot, I know I can always count on this place to make my stomach and heart smile.
author: Chiaki N.

description:
It's still my favorite place to go for a late night snack.  Their food is good for the price and they're open late!  

The service was disappointing the last time I went.  We were seated, then forgotten for about 10 minutes or so.  We waited and waited for someone (anyone!) to come and take our order, but they took orders from people at two other tables (who came in AFTER we did) before I had to finally wave them down.  The waitresses usually come up to your table after a few minutes - they kept passing my table up though..

Although their service was horrible, their food was good.  Their egg puffs were much better than those from Eggettes!  I got the porkchop and egg over macaroni.  It was tasty, but they should have cut up the porkchop before serving it.  Did they expect me to eat a full porkchop with chopsticks and a spoon?  The food itself was great though :)

So: 
4 stars for food.
2 stars for service.
author: Wayland L.

description:
good coffee pudding and steam eggs but very bad drinks.  the drinks are pretty watery and overly sweet after 3 times of visit.  It's a typical chinese dessert place where don't expect any good service but they open late so it's a good hangout spot late at night.  

I'll go back for the pudding but probably that's all.  Last time we also ordered steam rice noodles and waffle.  the waffle is nothing but the prepacked ones from grocery shop and filled with lots of cream and fruits.
author: Janita s.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night around 10:30p. Wasn't too packed. It was our 2nd choice since our first choice was full?!?! o__O" Anyway!
The server was really nice. :) Some of the stuff on the menu isn't there anymore.. So that knocked off a star. lol.
I got myself a hot milk tea and mixed fruit with mango pudding, since they didn't have coffee pudding. Food came pretty quickly! As did the food that my friends ordered. Fries. Egg Puffs. Milk tea pudding. Grass Jelly/Tapioca mixed fruit slush, thingy. Mango Ice Cream with Rainbox Jelly & Mixed Fruit... Not sure what the actual name of it was, but I'm sure it's easier to find. 
Everything was pretty awesome. And tasty. Decent prices. 
They also serve foods other than dessert, so it's pretty awesome. Gotta go back and try their other food!
author: Susan Y.

description:
I came here around 11PM with a few friends. I ordered the waffles with ice cream and mixed fruit, which was super yummy! The atmosphere is cozy and friendly. I would definitely recommend this place if you just want to have a good time chatting with friends over dessert. 

They also have a table full of board games and card games. My friends and I stayed here for hours playing Monopoly deal and we had a great time. I love the food and environment. Definitely recommend!
author: Kristina W.

description: What can I say about My Favorite Cafe........ except it isn't my favorite cafe, far from it. We came here on a Friday night for dessert and ordered the Nutella toast, cheurn fun, mango madness, and the sesame dumplings. Only the Nutella toast was good, everything else was below average. The service did not help either, it took them 15 minutes just to get our orders. They also messed up our order and charged us extra for something we did not order!!! I would not recommend this place but if your hungry and everywhere else is closed, I guess this place is better than nothing.....
author: Casey N.

description:
They open for late night, what can I ask for more? 

Their eggettes, steam noodle, mango ice cream on papaya, mango grapefruit tapioca were all good 

The wait staff were very friendly too. We had a big group, and the number keep growing. She was very patience with us.
author: Coco L.

description:
I use to come here a lot about 2 years ago? I haven't been back since. So it's been awhile ...

First off the girls don't really pay much attention to you unless you own a freaking penis! And mind you I was with 4 guys and still crap service..geez.

I ordered the Fish Balls with Radish and Pigskin but minus the pigskin and a Papaya Milk. The Fish Balls took almost 10 minutes for it come out. And when I tasted it, felt like something was definitely missing from the soup base. I couldn't put my finger on it but definitely could've been better. The Papaya Milk? Way TOO much milk and not enough papaya. It was so creamy looking and not even orange-ish looking in color. It was horrible and tasted mostly of milk and barely a hint of papaya. YUCK! Mind you I was still semi-hungry, having just gotten out of night class. So I ordered a Luncheon Meat and Egg sandwich. That was the only reason I gave this place 3 stars. It was great *smiles*. Soft bread crispy spam and eggs prepared just the way I like it. *thumbs up*
author: Linda X.

description:
I always said in the past I'm making a Yelp account just to give this place 1 star. Well I never got around to that for a while. Now that I did, I'm giving it 1 star.

The service. Terrible. Just as bad as it can get. Pretty much everytime I came here (plenty in the past), they've managed to mess up on SOMETHING. I mean really, it's like they want to win an award for messing up the most orders subtly before people actually catch on or something.
author: Lily L.

description:
Not a decent Denny's around in town (plz don't go to the one near Kabuki..yuck) near midnight? Head down to this spot. You're not going to find a Slam or omelettes but some awesome desserts, drinks, french toasts, PB sandwiches etc... Even if you don't' like Chinese food you'll find plenty of fruit type desserts if you're willing to try new things. I have no idea what the white "fungus" thing is on the menu but I'm sure it's good. If you want to try something good and safe try the Jellygrass. 

Things to look out for.. parking to be a pain.. it's cash only and can get busy after 11pm on Fri and Sat (though I usually don't have to wait for a table and when I did it wans't long). Also I've seen people waiting outside in the morning after the posted opening time on the door but it's still a solid place. Nice to bring a date if you are tired of the bars and want to try something new.
author: Dan T.

description:
I think I've tried everything on the menu... seriously they should give me a membership card....

No.44 (dry noodles with chicken wings, beef and soup) is my favorite.
gotta try the nutella french toast... love the milk tea pudding... love the black sticky rice with coconut milk.. love the strawberry madness... love the oreo milkshake.. love the strawberry juice... I like everything... it's definitely my favorite cafe.

the only thing I don't like... parking is a pain in da butt.
author: s d.

description:
when done with dinner on a casual night and you wonder where to go....no bars, no karaoke, no bowling/billards....dessert is the best choice. you can eat more, hang out and gossip on the latest while flipping through Chinese magazines.

in SF, this is "my favorite cafe!" the space is bigger than Kowloon Tong or Golden Island. price is better than Hui Lau San. most of the items on the menu are decent and it is nice just hanging out and blending in with all the young-ins.

*note: you may park at the bus stops after 8 pm
author: Katie K.

description:
out of most of the hk dessert places in sf, this is one of the few that i go to. I havent had a bad experience yet and ive always been pretty happy with what they serve. 

its not the best but its pretty good...

wondering whats soo good? well jus go to the other places and then come here and you can compare for yourself..
author: phillip w.

description:
Went to My Favorite Cafe the other night with Katie K. and Adam L.  Only Katie K. had been to the cafe, but only for dessert, so testing out the savory food was new for all of us.  As far as I can tell, it's a pretty typical Chinese/HK style cafe.  You get hot tea in plastic drinking cups, lots of savory and dessert options and low prices.  I opted for the beef stew over egg noodle (nixed the pork chop that accompanied the meal cause that's too much food).  The beef stew was tasty, but nothing too special.  The stew didn't lend too much sauce onto the noodles, but there was this small amount of paste that was off to the side of the bowl that added a great semi-salty taste onto the already yummy egg noodles.  The fried egg over medium (how I like my eggs) was a nice addition as well.  

We also ordered onion rings and besides catching up with old schoolmates, is the reason I wanted to go to My Favorite Cafe.  I love onion rings and though I try not to eat the greasy goodness too often, I'm always looking for a good ones.  These were pretty good...not too much batter, good size and crispy without being too saturated in oil.  I know where to go when I'm craving onion rings...great that it's in my neighborhood.

I think I'll have to go back to My Favorite Cafe and try the desserts next!  Mmmm...egg puffs, sago and milk teas.
author: Marie B.

description:
I come here so many times for late-night desserts with my friends, because one of my best friends lives around the area. Considering that I've lived in Hong Kong/China before, the chinese style desserts here definitely can't compare to those in asia, and the western desserts can't compare to the ones at places like cheesecake factory. But i would say that the desserts here are decent, and they have a lot of late night snacks that are really good when you're hungry at night too. 

My friend is a huge fan of their egg and spam ramen. It's kinda just like cup noodle, but it just tastes so good eating at midnight. Just don't get their egg puffs, they're not cooked right =/ 

Eitherway, I still come here a lot cuz it's the only decent azn dessert place open that late at night =P
author: Louisa L.

description:
Yesterday was the first time I came in here. A friend &I came here in the afternoon, so there weren't much customers. We ordered the Nutella french toast, deep friend banana with ice cream, chicken sandwich, green tea milkshake, &this one mango sago drink. The food was pretty good & was reasonably cheap. We spent a little bit less than $25 on everything. The service was a little slow, but really friendly.

I have yet to explore the rest of their menu &I am forsure coming back if I crave any Asian desserts.
author: BrendaJoy G.

description:
My Favorite Cafe will not be included in my series of reviews entitled "Places That Are Completely Empty on Friday Nights" because this place was jam packed around 9pm on Friday a few weeks ago. We were seeking some sweet goods after sushi and I remember hearing that this place was quite popular with the kids. Thinking it was similar to Quicklys where we could walk up to a counter and order our drink/snack, we were taken back when they kept asking us "how many?" implying that we needed to sit down. We checked out the menu and felt comfortable with the 200 choices so we took the only table left, in the back corner against the mirror. 

I was sick and couldn't try my friend's mango ice cream but it looked awesome. I had some kind of rainbow milk tea with hundreds of little pearls of different colors and tastes. The small size and texture made me feel like I was the egg and millions of sperms were trying to penetrate me to create the most beautiful baby that will be graced with my thick weave of dark curly hair. Although the thought of children was fun, feeling it going down my throat was not. 

The place takes cash only. If it was an awesome experience, I wouldn't have minded. But when it's only so-so, it pisses me off that they haven't joined the 21st century. I'm hypocritical and I don't care. 

I'd come back to try something else... perhaps during a less busy time. Until then, this is only My Favorite Cafe that's located between 22nd and 23rd Ave. Hopefully that title will expand to the Outer Richmond in the future.
author: Jared S.

description: My new favorite= the "Chinese handtossed noodles w/beef, chicken wings, spam and egg."
author: Vivian L.

description:
i actually used to hang around this neighborhood quite a bit and only now have i tried my favorite cafe.  we tried the bean curd dessert soup, egg puffs, and also ginger curdled milk.  

the place is pretty sunny in the late afternoon if you sit by the window.  their couches by the window show signs of sun damage.  there are hong kong tabloids to read there.

the bean curd dessert soup was pretty good.  you can add an egg if you want.  the egg puffs were too eggy in my opinion.  they should be a bit more floury, less chewy. i think genki really has mastered the recipe.  my ginger curdled milk was not what they said it was.  it was steamed milk.  if i said it in cantonese you would know the difference.  they falsely advertise!  they should just take it off the menu if they cant make it.  they already have the steamed milk on the menu anyways.  if i had known i would not have ordered it.  i almost wanted to send it back and tell them that was not what i had ordered.
author: claudia y.

description:
I like this place because it is large and roomy, and there's games and a TV in the back if you so desire playing games and hanging out.

Nothing was mind blowing, but I did enjoy the milk tea and egg puff I had.

Next time I'm going to try the savory options and see how that goes.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Soy sauce chicken is ok
Milk custard with sesame was good
Strawberry sago is great
Waffles with peanut butter is good
Sesame balls in soup was ok
author: Christopher L.

description:
I like this place. It's a pretty chill place...

They got hella choices to choose from. If you're hungry they got a wide variety of meals. Pretty basic food. Wouldn't really come if I was just looking for an actual meal, it's usually things you can just make at home...

But the desserts are really good. The mango madness is it?!? Something with mango. But that will satisfy that sweet tooth of yours. Also the sesame balls are good, soft and chewy(sounds... Nvm) but yes very crackin. 

They're open hella late on weekends so that's a plus. Service was kind and pretty quick no problem with that. The only thing is sometimes parking sucks. You'll pass it a couple times usually, before getting a nice spot... Other than that, it's cool...
author: Paul Christian M.

description:
The name is misleading, but if you're in the mood for some edible food on the cheap, you've come to the right place.  I came here with a friend and had a club sandwich with fries.  The fries were nice and crunchy, the sandwich wasn't too far off from what you'd get at Denny's but for a couple bucks cheaper.  They even had a few fried eggs in there for good measure.  Not bad for around five bucks.

You could also spend the same kind of money at Le Cafe just a few blocks down and get a much better sandwich, but you wouldn't get the the same variety.  You can also get soup, noodles, and rice dishes.  If you're a local that's feeling too lazy to cook, My Favorite Cafe might be the place for you.
author: Tony L.

description: Atmosphere definitely feels like late hang out spot for Asians....Taiwanese style. Came here after dinner for dessert. It was pretty empty (not late night yet). LOL! Menu has a pretty good selection of sweet delights from strawberry surprises, tapioca tea, and milk/egg custards. I also noticed people had order some dishes for dinner and there is also free Wi-Fi. Since it was cold outside, I wanted a warm dessert. Reminiscing when my mom made me custard at home, I browsed through the selections of egg and milk custards. I chose the egg custard (heavier then milk) with sesame paste. Custards always take awhile to cook, so while I waited I got to try the fun fun mango from someone else. Thanks! :O) Yes, fun fun was the flat noodles with lots of mango. Very fun and sweet! Finally, my dessert came out. It was in a warm bowl and it was like a yellow sun looking at me. I grabbed my spoon and broke the seal while the sesame paste oozed out for me to place on my spoon. As I placed it in my mouth, it gave me a warm tingling feeling. I love custards, sesame paste things like the sesame paste balls (tang yuan) with Chinese rice wine. Oh my! I can't wait to go back and try something else there
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
This place ROCKS! Me and my hubby have been the freq customers for the past 4 years. Once we moved in to the neighborhood, we came even more often. Not only the mango/aloe drink tastes good...their strawberry/aloe is awesome too! I have been soo many chinese dessert cafes and I would say they are the ONLY one making the foods/drink with HEART! One time me and my hubby getting abit sick and we ordered their 'braised pear soup' (not sure I name it correctly)...we were totally fine and felt nourish the following day.
 I need to make it 4 stars becoz ..sometimes their strawberry/aloe is not quite consistent. The regular staff would make a lot better than the new one...Their noodles are great. We hope they will come up with rice dishes one day....
Glad we dun need to park becoz we live close by...but if u r driving, yeah...parking is tough!!!
author: Skylar G.

description: This is definitely not my favorite cafe, and I'm not sure if it's really anybody's favorite cafe, and it probably isn't even the owner's favorite cafe.  I'm getting a little sick of Asian desserts.. but the papaya sago here was ridiculously bad.  It was extremely icey, and even having to pay four or five bucks for it wasn't going to make me finish that thing.  The fish balls are terrible - extremely rubbery, and it always takes more time than needed to get your food AND your check.  None of the staff speak English, but I think they should learn the words to simple things customers might ask for, like a toothpick.  I'm Asian, I'm not hating, but if it were me I'd make that effort.  Golden Island in the sunset is a better option.
author: Vivian H.

description:
My favorite cafe. I used to go to this place back in the day and the person who I think is the owner? Would always hook my friend and I with some free egg puffs thingy. Sometime the waitress would just bring it to our table without saying anything and we both would be like.. Huh? But thanks!

I always get the stir fried noodles, a little bit of "rooster sauce" did the trick! All the mangos stuff are usually good. The drinks I would get the coconut jelly with mango stuff. I love mango, I'm Thai, can't help it! 

I would definitely go back here if I get to stop by the neighborhood again. A great place to catch up with old friends and get the gang together!
author: Itthisak R.

description: Best Oreo Milkshake evar!!!!  mmmm large oreo chunks and excellent milkshake texture. Its so noisy in here though when its busy. oh yeah... they sell food like sandwiches and udon. I just want my shake =) p.s. oreo ice cream is my favorite flavor.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Great, I thought: a good place that's open late, for desserts, within walking distance of my home.  I'll come here, often. Was I wrong!

The girl showed me a photo of a "Hong Kong waffle". It had little puffs, with different fillings in it. I told her I had lived in HK for 3.5 years, and never heard of this dish; but I'd be willing to try it, if only they had chocolate filling. She said of course they have chocolate, so I said, "good, give me a chocolate".

Very disappointing to discover, at home, that it was NOT chocolate, but some gooey, tasteless yellowish paste filling. I saved it, to take it back.
