Next day, I was walking by, and went in to see the same girl. I reminded her that I was the guy here, late last night, ordering a chocolate waffle - but she gave me the standard item, instead. Her response: you ordered the standard. I reminded her of the conversation, but she was adamant. 

I figured I could handle that, in the future, so I said, give me a chocolate, now. I figured they would at least discount it. But she charged me full price. As she came back from the kitchen, I saw a sign, flat on the counter: "To-go" orders, $0.15 extra charge. I thought,  they have to be kidding; to-go is cheaper for them. How can they charge extra for it? So I asked her if she was charging me extra. She said, "of course".

At which point I told her to keep the food I had already paid for, that she was a thief, and that I won't ever be back, and that I'll tell a lot of people, on Yelp, about that place.

It's not MY favorite anything!
author: Ken M.

description: Was craving an egg puff when I was in the area. I remembered seeing this place when I did the pho challenge across the street. My wife was also craving mango pudding so we decided to stop by and check this place out. We seated ourselves when we walked in at around 4pm. We were the only customers at that time. I ordered an egg puff and she ordered her mango pudding. Her mango pudding came out right away while my puff took like 20-30 mins. The egg puff looked very appetizing and crisp. But when I tore off a piece, the egg puff was a grayish jello-y texture in the center. It wasn't really what I was expecting. Very very chewy. I couldn't even finish another piece. I'd say this was the second worst egg puff I ever had. Should had driven to eggettes instead.
author: Gordon C.

description:
Your average cafe place, but a little more "fun and colorful" looking. I like how they have some nicer chairs (more modern look) near the windows. Bright lighting, very cute. But the dessert... just as anywhere else right?

edit: came back again today 5/22/08 when my company wanted to go to Kowloon. I recall this place being neater and less crowded (an so I was right about the less crowded part (but probably because its a Thursday night at 11:30pm vs. Saturday night at 1am). The place is bigger than crowded and the tables are definitely arranged so that they aren't all cramped together. 

I had the curry fish balls, which weren't very curry-like (I prefer Kowloon's). The steamed custard with ginger was very yummy (and good for you). They messed up on the preserved vegetable & pork rice noodle and gave us macaroni instead, but my company had no complaints about the taste. We also had some sort of hot tapioca w/ coconut (sauce and actual slices of perhaps baby coconut), and it was very good. 

4 items and the total came out to be a little over $17 before tips.

edit 5/31/08 their coconut/mango drink doesn't compare to the one at Creations, but I still love this place. It was one of my friend's first time here, and even she said she likes this place more than Kowloon. It was Friday night yesterday around 1:45am when we came here, and it was not at all crowded. Their mango madness LOOKED and TASTED so good..
author: Elaine H.

description: Service was so so.  Not much people were there when I was there, which was around 3something near 4. I thought it was closed when I was two blocks away because it looked like it was closed..There is a Happy Hour type of menu. The things are a little cheaper.  I went there with my friends and we got battered onion rings, red bean shaved ice, and sesame egg puff. There was not much onion rings. The red bean shaved ice tastes like how every other place makes it. The sesame egg puff was okay, sesame seeds on it, I though it was going to be the sesame paste. I think it would've tasted better with the paste. The owner totaled up our bill wrong, but I it was just a mistake. He is kind of old anyways.  Pretty good experience, but I wished their tea would come in a mug instead of a plastic cup.
author: Janet Z.

description:
One of the many Hong Kong-style dessert and snacks places that my friends frequent. Decently priced and friendly service and ever so accomodating with large or small groups.
Tried several items here and they are all good, taro with sago dessert, black sesame, fruit bowls, fruit juices, etc....Gets crowded on weekend nights but for the most part, you can get seated fairly quickly.
author: Yan M.

description:
I don't know if My Favorite Cafe will actually become my favorite cafe, but it is a pretty nice HK-style cafe/dessert shop.

Stopped by with DY and CK after dinner because DY was hungering for some boba. No Taiwanese boba here, MFC is unabashedly HK in it's style. DY got the rainbow coconut milk, which was chock full of sago and various fruits. I think he liked it, but I also think he had really been hungering for boba. CK got the coconut milk milk custard, which she said was good and warm. I went with the sweetened tofu with red bean (hong bai dou fu hua). Not too bad, as dou hua goes, but I prefer mine sweeter than they make it. Maybe it's a Taiwanese thing?

Cash only, which kinda sucks. But I do like the lounge chairs near the windows.
author: Albert C.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $
Portions: 4/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 5/5
Overall: 4/5

THEY'RE USUALLY REALLY NICE, BUT SOMETIMES KIND OF SLOW ON PACKED NIGHTS. I LOVE LOOOOVE THE HOT MILK TEA + EGG PUFFS WITH CONDENSE MILK ON THE SIDE (:
author: Eva H.

description: This place is alright, but I've had better. Nothing special about the inside decorations. The waitress was actually pretty nice, but we waited a long time for the bill to come. The desserts were average, nothing creative or special. Overall, it's just an average dessert place.
author: Jane Z.

description:
this has GOT to be rigged. i've been here 3 times since my first visit. Each time pretty disappointing. i feel bad for the one girl who has to work all alone, but my smoothie took a good 30 minutes to come. 

the food was bleh, average at best. alright i got to stick to my guns and not come here. i feel as if i'm going to a whole different cafe then the rest of you guys
author: Garrett W.

description: Love it? Love it. LOVE IT!! This is the best go-to place after a night of clubbin, drinking, or hard partying! I love their ramen. Yea yea, I know I can very easily make it at home, but it just never tastes as good! My favorite thing to order at My Favorite Cafe is the combination ramen. I can't remember the number but I do want to say its #44. So the next time you go clubbin and you leave the club a little hungry, hurry over to My Favorite Cafe!!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
3.5 stars for My Favorite Cafe... I've seen many business in this location change time after time because there isn't enough foot traffic on the street and it's a pain to find parking there. 

I usually come here at night looking for dessert but today, I went at 4pm and there was Happy Hour.  They have a pretty good selection on dishes for the Happy Hour.  

Service is ok.  I've had good ones and bad ones here.  It's bad when the whole place is packed and there's only 2 people working.  It's a good place to hang out with friends late night and chill. 

HAPPY HOUR IS FROM 3PM-6PM MONDAY-THURSDAY
author: Kapo T.

description: I can only comment on the egg puffs here, but they were quite good. They were crispy and flavorful. I also liked that they used more batter to make them so you don't only end up with egg puff shaped shells.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description:
I like the fact that this place is not JAM packed all the time, so that when I want my Asian Dessert fix with some friends, I don't settle for sitting uncomfortably squished, trying to share a corner of a table.

Yes, the menu is extensive, but beware, some items my not be available if the kitchen is closed. 

+My first time here, I unknowingly ordered an ice cream basket, which for most asian dessert places would be a tiny serving; however when it come out... it was a HUGE. I was really like a basket full of ice cream. 4 large scoops of 4 flavors of ice cream with fruit and whipped cream. My jaw dropped, and I ordered my friend to help a sister out because it was too big. 

+I'm all about getting a bang for your buck, so that a great first impression for me.

-Pass on the egg puffs, they're not very good here.
-The servers are not always very attentive, so if you want something, be proactive.
author: Angel L.

description:
They have all sorts of new-fangled desserts (like milk-tea pudding, or sesame paste mixed with egg pudding), if you're into those.

Too bad it's not off Geary, but on a quieter part of Clement - maybe that's good for those of you that don't want to wait for a table.
author: Haywood H.

description: I've been to this place a bunch of times for late night dessert. If you're from SF, you know that service isn't that great. They don't come every now and then to check up on how you're doing with your food so you have to flag them down if you want anything. I always get the chicken sandwich which is pretty good. Always a good place to just eat, chill, and play cards if you're with a bunch of friends.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
I ordered mixed fruits sago w/ strawberry juice. The juice part of it tasted good. I think there's some sugar  or syrup in the 'strawberry juice' b/c not all strawberries are sweet. The papaya and some mango pieces tasted funny.. It tasted bitter! like the bad rotten kind...but I ate it anyway? Some of the sago was gooey.. Not enough juice with the sago dessert.

The seasame eggettes are good! I'd prefer eggettes to be a bit soft, not crunchy.

They have lots of interesting desserts & snacks.

Free tea..free lollipops.
author: Jay Z.

description:
My friend and I were driving around the area looking for a HK bistro of some sort and somehow discovered this place.  It looked really clean and bright from the outside as we drove by Sunday night at 11.

We parked and headed inside.  The menu is large, yet seemingly lacking in the tofu department.  We decided to try a handful of items: deep fried sweet breads, beef stew with lettuce, curry fish balls, and green tea shake.  The service was fairly spot on with tea brought by with regularity and tables being cleared immediately after patrons left the cafe.

The green tea shake was a little strange.  The wafer cookie inside was good, yet the taste of the drink overall had a strange green tea and matcha flavor with cardboard-esque aftertaste.  It wasn't what we expected, but it was fine by any means.

The sweet breads are delectable.  If you love condensed milk, then this little piece of dough will not let you down as it comes with a condensed milk as a dipping sauce.  

The curry fish balls had a ton of cumin and packed a small punch.  

As for the beef stew with lettuce, my first impression was why would you order this?  It smelled like an Asian Big Mac.  I kid you not.  The wilted lettuce and random beef bits in the sauce seemed like a scaled back stew and smelled just like secret sauce.  Strange...  It was fairly tasty though.

If you come here after 8, make sure you plan on ordering something at least $2.50 in value.  Also, make sure you bring cash as that is all they accept.

I would certainly hit this place up if I lived in the area.  It's cheap and has great desserts--the waffles covered with ice cream and fruits looked delectable and certainly mouth-watering.  Be sure to check it out if you're in the area.
author: Brent A.

description: This is a pretty average dessert spot. Parking is a lot easier later in the evening.
author: Forest S.

description:
My friend is absolutely obsessed with fried bananas.  Definitely in her top 5 foods, if not part of her Last Meal on Earth.

This wonderful cafe has them just the way she likes them, which she has explained to me in detail.  The batter has to be just right, chocolate sauce, some powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and there better be some ice cream on the side (preferably green tea).  This place fit the bill.

I got the waffles with ice cream and fresh fruit.  And perhaps I should have specified that I um, don't like my waffles well done.  I could hardly cut through them!  I was quite tempted to ask for a steak knife.  Could have just been a one time thing on their part, leaving the waffles cooking for too long or something.  The vanilla ice cream they served with it was nice though, and eventually got the waffles soft enough for me to cut through.  After about ten minutes.  

Yet still, I will go back to sample some more of their unique desserts.
author: Mary O.

description:
any place that is open until 12:30 on a weekday gets an A in my book. add the fact that they serve DELICIOUS desserts and food for cheap, and it gets an A freaking +.

so far i've tried the onion rings, which aren't as greasy as most places, the ramen noodles with spam, egg, chicken wings, and some beef thing.. mango madness, egg custard with ginger, and sesame dumplings. every single item has hit the spot and only cost about $5! service is kind of spotty but whatever, it's an asian place. there is one guy that works here who's actually pretty nice and friendly. 

parking sucks, but if you go later on a weekday it should be fine. 

this is totally my favorite cafe.. mwahaha. lame. i know, but i had to.
author: Angela L.

description:
The reason I want to try MY FAVORITE CAFE because I was reading the review from Yelp and a lot of ppl gave good review. I decide to go there to try it on Sunday afternoon. 
We order the Hong Kong waffles and I like the way they cut the waffle really small, but it is kind of oily.  the price is really good and it is only 3.75. :-)

Also, we order the mango chow fun that make with coconut . it is really interesting , but the coconut chow fun look alike taste really refreshing.   I love it...
author: Isabelle L.

description:
Ya know..I thought this place was Kowloon Tong or Golden Island Cafe when I looked at the menu before me. I'm used to this type of food since I grew up with it. It's got a good atmosphere, loaded with Chinese people late nights and oOo mango sago. Good stuff on a hot day. really though..this place is good. I'll seriously go bonkers w/o my late night snacks. 

So for you health freaks out there, this place is healthy and unhealthy at the same time. It all depends on what you order.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
I came here last week with a good friend of mine.  As it turns out one of our old middle school buddies is the owner.  WOOT! Hook it up s0n!

This is a pretty chill place for hanging out with some friends.  It's fairly spacious with plenty of tables, but it can fill up pretty quickly and soon everyone is chatting away at full volume.  The menu boasts an eclectic mix of over 120+ combos of drinks, fruits, desserts, snacks, noodle bowls as well as variety of hot dishes to please just about anyone's taste.

My friend ordered; My Favorite Cafe Jellygrass Special, $6.95, and I got the Mixed Fruit w/Honeydew Juice $4.25.  Our friend hooked us up with free Eggettes!  The fruits & jellygrass blended pretty well with the eggettes.
author: Tom Y.

description:
I really, really fretted about writing my 100th review, but this happened in the perfect place at the perfect time. 

I've been coming to My Favorite Cafe (or MFC, for short) for several years now; they have always been open late enough that if we got off work at the movie theater, we could get here and indulge in dessert or 'fourth meal', as we were still amped up from working all night. We started coming here so often for a spell that the owner would always say 'hi' when we walked in, immediately seat us, regardless of the hour, and would take our orders in a timely fashion. We've watched them turn people away who walked in right after us - now THAT'S service to loyal patrons! Another bonus about MFC is that they don't have a minimum (as far as I can tell) per person for ordering - which means you don't HAVE to get something even if your friends have the munchies; many places do have this kind of rule, and I find it to be stupid. Nicely done MFC.

They have a pretty basic setup; when you walk in, there are a row of tables to your right for smaller parties - say, less than 4, and some rounds pushed together for parties of 5 or more. There's a stack of magazines in the back in Chinese, and they always have some kind of entertainment channel running on the TV in the back, and I think they offer wireless now too. There are also 2 front seats with four comfy chairs, but be warned it's ALWAYS cold in those window nooks! It can feel more private sitting over there, but it can make it more of a challenge to flag down a server to get stuff taken care of. 

MFC has an extensive menu, and there is always something that you want on it, from egg puffs to sundaes to hot desserts to numerous cold desserts to savories like fish balls and fries. We usually order at least one of everything I have named, and we have still not tried everything on the menu - there are close to 130+ items. While the fruit is not as fresh as Creations, they make up for it in the level of extensive menu, and having things on the menu clearly labeled, which is a plus when you are allergic to peanuts (this has been a problem for me in other Chinese dessert cafes). They are usually pretty quick about turning the orders out, but things can come out unevenly from time to time - tonight, we waited for our waffle sundae to come out for an ungodly amount of time, but I think part of that was to blame on the waitstaff - they have some majorly ditzy girls working there right now, but they were eager to help, and came around and refilled the hot tea that is always served. 

I have been so many times, and cannot remember a single time I walked away disappointed. I am always blessed with good friends who go with me, and we always have had a good time.

Parking can be a nightmare here, and it's cash only, but for now, it will always be "My Favorite Cafe"
author: Jessica S.

description: It was alright. I like that they close late but their service wasn't that great, especially if you get stuck sitting near the window on those comfy chairs.
author: Sophia S.

description:
For a late night bite, there is no better place than my favorite cafe, yes, the name says it all. I love the friendly service, egg puffs are awesome, especially with whipped butter, the mozzarella sticks freaking rule!

Coconut milk with tapioca was what was to be expected in the name sake-speaking of which, does anyone know what stewed snow frogs are? The french toast with ham and cheese is drop dead delicious, with a lot of maple syrup! my stomach is still thanking me for that one!
So if your not on a diet and need late night sweets, this is the place to be!!!
author: mia l.

description: Compare to other dessert places, this cafe has the least costumers during busy nights. That was why I decided to go in and give it a try. My friend and I didn't know what to order, so we took a while to look through the menu. The waitress keeps coming back to us every five minutes when we didn't even ask for her! She then got pissed off that we were taking so long, and gave us "the face". So my friend and I thought that she was totally rude, so we ordered two cups of hot lemon tea just to mess around with her. It was definitely the worse drink I had ever drank! It was literally nothing but sugar water with a piece of lemon. We didn't even bother ordering the food because the tea ruined everything. My friend was nice enough to give them five dollar tips, cuz if it was for me, I would of just paid for the drink and leave. In fact, we only took one sip of that nasty sugar water.
author: Ariel J.

description: wait a little bit longer after we are finish odering the food, but the service still very good. before we are done, the onwer came to us , and asked us how is the food tase, how to improve, things like that. she is very care a bout her busniess!! keep going!!
author: Robert V. D.

description: I only get one thing here...the steamed milk custard. It is super yummy. I've never eaten any other foods here. I had the most delicious steamed milk custard in Hong Kong and have been trying to find something comparable. So far My Favorite Cafe has come the closest.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I've just been here for the first time the other night with my husband.  It was so cheap and tasty!  We sampled cheese sticks, sesame balls, deep fried sweet bread (no, not the french kind) and a shake.  I could've eaten 3-4 servings of sweet bread. Then again, I'm a starch freak who can eat bread and rice with any meal. 

If you're looking for a funky late night cafe for some authentic HK style dessert and drinks, you'll love MFC.
author: Joanne D.

description: Good egg puffs, open late. Try the strawberry desserts, too. Don't expect service or clean bathrooms, though
author: Warren L.

description:
The best dessert place in SF!  I think they beat out Kowloon and Golden Island hands down.

The selection is huge and they have good daily specials with authentic cantonese desserts.  Favorites include:

B-jelly (can be shared by 2-4 people)
sesame paste stuff
steamed egg or egg white with sesame paste
most of the dessert soups
egg puff
soy sauce chicken wings
mid-night snacks (noodles, etc)

Good stuff and getting more crowded every weekend now..
author: Bessie T.

description:
It's not all great. But it's not all bad.
1 star for the CRAZY mangoness. I love most.
+1 star for showing the Bee movie!
+2 for the right in front of the store parking.
Mango Madness; MADNESS REALLY?! I didn't see what I wanted.
But I like the mango..
Love the ice cream, just like everywhere else with ice cream.
Cute baby too! 
I was talking about Eggettes with my friend, and some person just intruded.
And started a conversation on their own about eggettes.
Kinda uncomfortable... but it was alrighty. I feel lame, after eatting all these deserts!  I like creations (:
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
Late-night talks!  

This place is perfect if you're looking for a place to just talk late into the night.  I have had many of conversations that took a wild and intriguing turns...so it brings back fond memories.

Their Asian desserts are pretty good - pretty standard in comparison to other places.  Their food selection is pretty big and I've had a range of ramen to red bean paste tofu...

So if you're looking for a late nite munch with a friend - I'd def come here!
author: Julie H.

description:
I love it! I love it! I love it!

The weird things first - more than anything, it's an issue of asking the serving staff to translate unfamiliar menu items for you.  Pure entertainment.  "What is a momochacha?"  We asked several times and we're still not sure, but we think it has beans.  Also, apparently "snow frog" is really actually quite literal - frog fat.  We know this, but we continue to inquire each time we go.  If you can, try to get the big dude who kind of looks like Doraemon http://collateraldamage.files.wordpress.com/2008/03/doraemon.jpg with the glasses and the short hair as your server.  He's really nice and helpful, and tries really hard to explain the dishes to you.

But anyway, they have a whole assortment of red bean, black sesame, walnut, almond, tofu, taro, tapioca, etc.-based desserts, hot and cold.
author: Jerry Z.

description: The egg puffs here are nasty! It had the texture of raw dough when you bit into it.  I also had a 3 colored dumpling with peanuts, sugar, and syrup which tasted carrot,squash and something I couldn't quite make out. The service was decent
author: Jack L.

description:
I ordered the:

Mango Milkshake-$3.99

Egg Puffs- I do not remember how much they cost. 

The mango milkshake tasted weird and I cannot really describe the taste. It may have been too sweet or the mango ice cream they used was not good. The fresh mangos and the whipcream they put in was good though.

The egg puffs were good, crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. 

I also tried some of the Strawberry Madness. It had fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, and it all sits on top of strawberry jello. It tasted good, but it was hard to eat because everything sat on top of the jello.
author: Joseph F.

description: The amount of oil/grease/lard that was in the bread of the sandwich I had ordered was enough to put me off. I left disappointed and hungry.
author: Nadia A.

description: Its just like any other Asian dessert spot.  I came with a huge group after a wedding banquet so I got to try a few other items. There's was the black sticky rice with coconut milk which was not too sweet at all and the best waffle and ice cream I've ever laid eyes on.  Overall I thought the desserts were good. I had the coconut milk with white fungus and tapioca. It was really good and don't let the name fool you.They also have chocolate chip egg puffs! How weird is that?! Gotta try it yourself.
author: Jeanne L.

description: The service was pretty fast. I order the chicken sandwich was was good.  My friends ordered desserts. I just got off work and I was hungry.  We got here after one o'clock in the morning.  Not lot of people before it closes for the night.  Take only money.
author: John F.

description:
My cousins, sisters, and friends frequent this place a least 3 times a month.  Though I come less, the others have made it a traditional trek to dessert after dinners to eat sweets we don't eat at home and to get together outside of obligatory familial settings.

This place has an extensive menu, like Kowloon Tong.  I don't venture past familiar foods so i always get the turtle dessert or the sweet tofu. If I'm in the mood for some food, then i order the rice noodle plate with the different dipping sauces. That's always yummy. I ordered a deep fried "man tao" once and was a bit disappointed with it.

The service is always decent, but seating is sometimes a rarity if you come on a weekend night.  Regardless of the wait, I'll still go back. It's become a ritual for us.
author: A L.

description:
My friend and I joined my best friend and her cousins for her cousin's birthday so we were a pretty large group.  Since my friend and I arrived much later than the rest of the party, we were seated at a separate table.  Since it was our first time at My Favorite Cafe, we needed a few minutes to look over the menu before deciding what to order.  We went with the Strawberry Madness and when our order came out, it definitely was not strawberry.  I believe they confused our order for another table's and brought over some type of mango dessert instead.  When we informed them of their mistake, they took a while to even take it back which caused us to get a few weird looks from the table who did order it.  After a couple of minutes, our server finally took the wrong order from our table and when she returned with the correct order, it seemed to have melted a bit.  Whenever my food comes out lookin' like that, it always makes me wonder how long our server passed it up and just let it sit out in the kitchen but whatever. Our Strawberry Madness was pretty good, so I give 'em an extra star for that. 

In conclusion.. will I be returning for another visit? No, mainly because parking was a bitch that night and the service could have been much better. It looks like this is not My Favorite Cafe afterall.
author: Gabby T.

description: I had dessert with friends one late friday night and i must say, it was okay. The only thing that disgusted me was their fifthy bathrooms! Soo gross. They need to clean their bathrooms ASAP! The foood was okay. I had the sundae with waffles and the waffles tasted exactly like the egg puffs. It was not as goood as I thought. I experienced better places than this!
author: Stella C.

description: The food was pretty good. I had the strawberry madness which was worth my money. However, the service was terrible. My friend ordered the sesame soup, but he did not receive it due to their screwup by mixing different batters together. In addition, after we finished out dessert, it literally took them 30 mins to give us our check and thats only because we asked. If we didn't ask for the check who knows how long we could have been sitting there. Oh wait get this, there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant! How can you not notice that we were waiting for the check? Do you not want us to pay you? Bad service!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
So my boy friend brought me here, which a friend showed him this place. I like the restaurant how its very decorative and cute.. but the food.. wasn't the best. So i ordered rice noodles with curry balls which was a big mistake because first of all they gave me like 3-5 curry balls in a big bowl of rice noodles with water O.O. It was soo hard for me to finish and i was really upset because this was the very first CAFE my boy friend took ME!! he also ordered a milk tea which it totally didnt even taste like milk tea, for one thing it jus tasted like raw tea and they put food coloring into the milk tea to look like milk tea i don't know..
    Well soo because i wasnt full at all, i thought maybe the deserts would taste better. My boyfriend ordered a sundae... that stuff was sooo sweet!!
  Maybe i just didn't pick the right food from this restaurant and there and hopefully next time if i DO come back to this place, i just hope it would be better. And really dont order the curry fish balls with rice noodles it is SOOOOO PLAIN!
author: Alice C.

description: this place was better than i expected.  we had the sesame paste balls, soy dessert, custard with sesame, and red bean soup.  all tasted good.  nice way to wrap up our dinner date with friends.  service was fine since we were the only table when we got there.
author: s t.

description: Good place to grab a midnight snack! The only place I know in San Francisco that opens late and actually serves hot food!
author: Amy C.

description: Had the waffles with ice cream and fruit and a mango pudding.  Although it is not super expensive, I would say it wasn't all too great.  The waffle was like chewing on cardboard, the fruit wasn't fresh at all, and they gave us the wrong ice cream flavors =(.  I guess you pay for what you get.
author: Clifford C.

description: let's go to my favorite cafe!  that never gets old.  anyway, desserts here are great when i can drag my friends away from the bars.  mango pudding is good.  honeydew juice with tapioca is really good.  honey w/ lemon is nice when you're already desserted out.  and oh!  the egg puffs!  so good.  service is decent too.  you definitely never feel rushed to clear your table.  i'm pretty sure you could stay there from 8pm to 2am straight and they'd never "rush" you by putting your check on the table.
author: spiff e.

description: The egg puff was good.  The tri-color peanut dumpling is not the same as the ones in HK.  But can do.
author: Crystal L.

description: it is kind of pricey, i tried the mango delight.. my friend had like the strawberry madness, it looked nice! but  it tasted okay.. the mango delight was better, this isnt the best dessert place i went to, but its okay. there was only one person working here, the service wasnt the best.
author: Bailey L.

description: Although this is "My Favorite Cafe," this unfortunately isn't my favorite cafe. They have some decent hot food, but their desserts are so-so. There is nothing really special about this place. I like 100% Sweet Cafe better!
author: Sam W.

description:
After dinner at Genki Ramen...

Me: Lets go to My Favorite Cafe, I haven't been there in a while.
Friend: ok, where is your favorite cafe? 
Me: No, its not MY favorite cafe. Its their name, which sucks, because it isn't really MY favorite cafe. But I don't feel like the crappy customer service at Kowloon Tong.

which leads to a meager 3-stars at Kowloon Tong. I had the mango delight (yeung gee gum lo) which is mango + pomelo + small tapioca. It was sickening sweet and lacked the fruity flavors. The friend ordered 2 scoops of ice cream. Now - my advice to you - when you go to a HK-style cafe, you don't order ice cream! You know that they get their ice cream from those 2 gallon buckets at Foods Co. Its like going to Baskin Robbins and ordering **gasp** Vanilla! No offense, but you can buy a half-gallon of Dreyers at Safeway for wayyy less. Ok, back to topic. So the friend gets her 2 scoops of green tea ice cream and it was horrid. It was bitter, had no green tea flavor whatsoever, and had that ice burn smell. Nasty. So we asked the server if we can get another flavor instead. The server was very nice and promptly exchanged it to Mango for us. Once again, nothing spectacular. It was sweet and had that artificial flavoring color. Note to My Favorite Cafe: please do your customers a favor order your ice cream from Magnolia or Polly-Anns.. or at least get the real stuff with no artificial flavoring!
author: Nancie T.

description: This is one of my favorite places to go to for late night desserts & snacks . Their "My Favorite Cafe Tossed Noodle" is SO GOOD ! But it's a bit over priced . I had the fried buns last night ( haha ) with condensed milk-- mmm soo good !!! The prices are pretty reasonable . Although it's kind of far for me to go to, it's still worth it because the food is good . Even my mom & her friends come here -___-"
author: Jenny Y.

description: Decent late night snack place.  I ordered the beef brisket instant noodle and liked it.  The service was faster than other typical Chinese late night snack/dessert restaurant.
author: Chad S.

description: Came here for a late night meal.  The menu is an ecclectic mix of strange dishes, if you've never been to a cafe like this before.   The place was pretty empty when we got there, but the service kinda sucked.  Some of us ordered food and some ordered dessert, but the ones who ordered both received their desserts before the meal portion - that just sucks!  I want to eat my meal before my dessert.  The food is decent, a little too much soy sauce in my preserved veggie and chicken rice noodle dish, but the mango dessert made me want to go back to HK and eat a mango dessert place!
author: Christine C.

description: This is the place for desert. I LOVE THE nutella french toast with a side of ice cream. Its also very cheap. The only thing that sucks about this place is that they dont take CARD!! BUT ITS still a great kick it spot ususally at night when there is nothing to do.
author: reyahliza b.

description: Food isn't the best in the world, but if you have a late night craving for some sweets or a snack, this is the place to go!
author: Tony L.

description: As a Chinese Dessert fan, this is definitely one of my go-to places when I'm craving dessert. This is one of my favorite places. The other being Golden Island on Noriega. They have more savory meal options here as opposed to Golden Island. And, also serve eggettes and waffles unlike Golden Island. I finally tried the My Favorite Cafe tossed instant noodles my last trip and was not disappointed at all. I loved the pile of meat which they put on the large serving of tasty noodles. It's definitely not a healthy option for dinner every night but it does satisfy you when you are craving it.
author: Lisa M.

description:
there is a reason why they call this place 'my favorite cafe' because it really is my favorite cafe.  everything on their menu, no matter how simple, or confusing is always made to taste great.  

overall, this place have friendly owners, parking can be a pain, they open late, depending on date/time there can be a giant wait.  it's definitely worth coming here if u're thinking about it.  come with one person, come with a crowd... all are welcome.  i must've came here at least 20 times in the last few months.
author: Tina L.

description: This past weekend I was in San Francisco and I drove past My Favorite Cafe. Aside from the fact that this place only takes cash, I really have to say that this is one of my favorite dessert/snack place to go to in San Francisco. It's not that their food is super duper yummy fabulous, but it's the fact they remind me a lot of Hong Kong. I always order the waffle sandwich with condensed milk and peanut butter, curry fish balls, ramen, and steamed chang fen. Every time I eat there I think about all those times I spent at the little Central snack at the CUHK campus.
author: Rennie C.

description: SO FUNNY, I couldn't help but laugh, when i ordered mozzarella sticks and pot stickers at the same time!!! I felt like a little kid making dinner for myself. sounds funny, but I loved it. Service was friendly and fast. Prices are incredibly cheap. Its a great place to stop in for a snack. And they are open Late! And I love a late snack!
author: Joy I.

description: Such a unique, late-night place!  Hong Kong-influenced desserts and snacks, with overly friendly girls serving you and Chinese soap-operas serenading you.  Some of the things on the menu have odd names (I've not had the courage to try the "snow frogs", etc.), but the dessert concoctions are amazing!  The prices are quite cheap, and if in a group, you could get a few plates of mozzarella sticks, curry fish balls, and dessert drinks and you're good.
author: Cooper S.

description:
i'm always down for a place that you can roll hella late, sit there forever playing your cards, and nosh on a gigantic menu of treats.. yay.

i went here cuz it was past twelve and my bf and i had a serious case of the munchies.. so we ordered: 
- the eggettes: pretty good. but not as crispy as i would have wanted it.
- the waffle with ice cream and fruit: the waffle was crispy. and the fruit was decent. the ice cream was.. meh. more icy than creamy.
- the taro with tapioca: i thought it was a drink. it wasn't. it was a bowl with warm taro and tapioca. i was pleasantly surprised.
- the peanut butter thick toast: f-ing awesome. nuff said.
- and this "speacial tofu dish with red bean and sesame paste" that didn't have any tofu in it: wtf? minus one star. boooo. i wanted tofu.

other than that.. it was chill. i'd go back and try some more stuff.. maybe this time i'll bring board games and sit in the comfy chairs by the window..
author: geneive j.

description:
Ever since my friend showed me this cafe, I've loved it a lot.
It's more of a snack to a comfortable meal kind of cafe, not those fancy kinds. I went here for my birthday, and it was spectacular. They even gave me about eight scoops of different flavored ice creams, and a candle to blow out!
author: N W.

description: Very Cheap. Good on the wallet. But 99% of the menu is just frozen and heated food. Some of the stuff gives me stomach cramps and some don't. Just be careful what you order. The fruit is usually fresh-ish though. For a cheap place it's decent.
author: Loren B.

description: I've been here about a half a dozen times and the food here is OK. I've only tried their desserts and have never had a meal here. You get the typical Chinese desserts that are served at other Chinese establishments. They are open late which is a plus and if you only go during the late evenings, parking isn't bad. It does get pretty loud sometimes. The only minor problem I had was that one time I ordered a cup of coffee with cream and sugar and the girl brought me whip cream. They didn't have any cream and it took a while for them to tell me or understand what I was asking for. From what I understand, they serve coffee differently. Anyway, I still think this place is OK and will be returning.
author: Diane M.

description: THEY NEED TO HIRE MORE PEOPLE! it takes FOREVER for them to bring out the food. you barely get any costumer service. at times, you have to sit there for 10+ mins just to catch the waitress' attention to order your food. however, i really like the atmosphere there. its a place where u can really go to just chill and chat with your friends. they have enough varieties to keep you satisfied with a reasonable price. im definitely a regular, but their slow service is quite annoying.
author: Anita C.

description:
I've been going to My Favorite Cafe for almost 2 years now.  The eggettes and house special ramen are definitely my favorite because it always satisfies the stomach on a hungry midnight in search for a decent place.  

Compared to the other dessert places around the area, this place has more "real food" ie noodles and sandwiches, but at the same time a lot of dessert as well.  It's inexpensive, has friendly service, and is definitely a nice place to hang out late at night.
author: Emily L.

description: This is the place I go to when I get a weird Asian dessert craving. Its the first Asian dessert place I have been to & I don't mind it (I'm still trying out other places). The best part is that their open super late! Easy to get to with lots of parking. I've tried the mango delight, the waffles with ice cream, and the fried banana which were all good. But I cant figure out their ice cream... their strawberry taste too strawberry almost fake and their coconut is a bit to coconutty for me, but it tastes fine eaten with whatever its served.
author: Maritess N.

description: Love their desserts here! Everything is good and fresh. I usually order the sesame dumplings, dun dan (egg custard), or mango pudding. Minus 1 star for letting the place get kinda dirty. It used to be really clean!
author: Al T.

description: Great place to hang out. friendly customer service. They GOT EGG PUFF!! always crispy. and i love those Peek A Pooh machines!!!  Ya got to try the waffle ice cream sandwich!! lovin it.....the sandwich. They got tons of great desserts. and i know people that love their curry balls...fish. So go there now. and tell Philip I need more watermelon or ill hold the RiceRolls for ransome.
author: Mark F.

description: pretty nice place with good dun lai.  The cherng fun is good too with the dipping sauces.  I'm not a big fan of the soy sauce chicken wings though.
author: Stevezee C.

description: My Favorite Cafe is absloutely my favorite cafe for Chinese desserts. They have  a large selection of both savory and sweet foods. My favorites are sago w/ coconut milk, waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream and the coffee tea.
author: Jennie N.

description: The perfect place to grab a midnight snack or some eggettes.  My son loves the eggettes from this place.
author: Allison T.

description: We call this place "the G-spot" among our friends that is.  It's our code word when our night's not yet over, but want to finish it off and/or sober up at a place that serves food and dessert.  The eggettes are yummy.  This is actually the first place I've ever tried an eggette.  Other items I've enjoyed are their egg sandwiches, ice-cream waffles, lychee drinks, and everything with noodles.
author: Michael B.

description: We came here last night for a friend's birthday. She wanted dessert, so one of our friends recommended this cafe. We got here around 7:30PM, but everyone lagged and we didn't start ordering until about 9:00PM. The majority of us ordered the waffles with mixed fruit and ice cream. We didn't know it takes FOREVER just to make one order. They probably had only one waffle maker or something. Everyone was almost already finished eating, but about three of us hadn't even got our orders yet. The service was extremely slow, but the food was pretty good.
author: Jade V.

description:
I haven't found a better dessert cafe yet. They open until 2AM on Friday and Saturdays which helps when my friends and I aren't yet ready to turn in. Our favorites include ramen/udon noodles with spam and egg (it's hard to explain the phenomenon on why it's better when you buy ramen noodles instead of making it at home yourself), chow mein noodles, egg puffs, watermelon juice with tapioca, bread puffs with sweet sauce, and mango with ice cream and pudding. 

The servers are inarticulate and get confused some of the times, but the owner of the place is very gracious and nice. This place continues to cater to our habitual late night hang outs, hilarious conversations, obnoxious laughs, and such.
author: Kathy L.

description: I love the French Toast the most. It's thicker than what you get from other Cantonese cafe. And to serve with powder sugar on top.
author: cynthia l.

description: price means alot-quality isn't soo bad but i wish they could accept cards. It's a great place to something sweet and cheap. Menu has a very wide selection. I come here at least once a month.
author: Ateh M.

description: Snacks, dessert, friendly service and cheap prices... a little girls dream!
author: Blu n.

description:
nothing about this place performed very well, but i like places that are open late that aren't bars or clubs.

your average late-night asian dessert place. good cheung fun with the spicy sauce. egg puffs are not so great. their's were kinda heavy and on the chewier side. we also ordered these soft tri-colored dessert balls that were just ok and were really small. the service was also slow, even though the place was pretty empty.
author: Kan L.

description: Best selection of HK desserts and snacks in the city! Although Golden Island Cafe beats them on their fruit desserts, My Favorite Cafe has a better selection with egg puffs and other snacks. They also have better service, less of a wait, better complementary tea. Prices are comparable to Golden Island Cafe. Unless you really have a fruit sago craving, I suggest trying out this place as Golden Island Cafe gets crowded on the weekends.
author: Empress C.

description: This place is pretty good and has it's desserts but I still prefer Kowloon Tong along 7th and Geary anyday. I'll go here once in awhile for their desserts though since they have different ways in serving from what I get in Kowloon and their Sesame paste with Milk custard which is delicious! The mango Ice Cream pudding is well worth with how much you get. The mixed fruits w/ Mango juice and sago which is one of my primary dishes isn't as good as the one I get at Kowloon. They over do it with the sago/tapioca, whatever you prefer to call it and my last visit, our tea's tasted straight outta the faucet tap water status...it was disgusting. Service is nice though and only reason it's staying at a 4 stars for me is cause of service and the desserts I like there.
author: Sean E.

description: Wide variety of dishes available, and it's the only thing open on this part of Clement late at night. Staff was very friendly. The peanut dumplings were mediocre (several spoonfuls of sugar on top of a few bites of dumpling) but the potstickers are fantastic. Wouldn't come back here for a meal, but it's nice for a late night snack.
author: Evan and Christine J.

description: came here one day with my friends for a late night dessert. it was pretty good, i really liked the rice noodle snack thing! yummy! the usual asian dessert but the company made it the best
author: Krystal L.

description:
The first time i went i had a pretty good experience since it was just me and two friends who went for a late night dessert on a weekday, it took us about 45 minute or less to order, take or time to eat, and get out of there.

The second time we went, it was on a Sunday night, this time it was with 3 others too cause one of the friend said he wanted to go there, it was very pack, we was seated by the window on the sofa because we had 6 people and there were only 4 sofa, so we had to grab two other chairs from other tables, the service was not great at all, it took them forever to take our order, but the dessert came within 15 min only because we had hot dessert, after we were done, we had to literally flag down the waitress to get our bill, no joke, even though they were just standing at the counter doing possibly nothing since everybody was eating and had their order. Oh, did i mention because we had a small area the waitress didnt even say excuse me or what so ever and just squeeze her way their me and one of my friend to put tea on the table, like seriously? me and my friend was moving to the side, she couldnt wait but to squeeze her way through, that night was our last night there!
author: lisa m.

description: I came here for the first time the other night. It's good for late night snacks. It wasn't too crowded when we came so the service was pretty quick...almost too quick. The food we ordered was good although I was a little disappointed by their fried fish balls (I like Quickly's better). I'd definitely come back.
author: Tiff L.

description: Great place to go when you're hungry late at night and want more then just dessert!  Few friends brought me here one night and they had some pretty decent food.  They also have desserts that they serve at other dessert restaurants and yummy drinks.  If you're craving for a place to eat late night, you can't go wrong with this place.
author: Justin H.

description:
the food here is pretty good. they have a wide variety of desserts and the regular food is also good.
their prices are average but they also have a happy hour. the menu selection for happy hour is limited but everythiing on there is almost half off.
author: Tashi. O.

description: This place will never let you down because its inexpensive and local. They have the best late night Chinese comfort food from noodles to pastries that would have you coming back for more. The best thing is that its open till 2am on some nights. Check it out...
author: Carlton A.

description: ordered the waffle with fresh fruit and ice cream. i ended up with a partly burnt waffle with bitter ice cream and some can fruits. my friend ordered black sticky rice with fresh fruits to give it a try, since the worker said it was good and sweet. the black sticky rice was bitter and it didn't even taste cooked. the rice was still hard and the only good thing about the it was the "fresh" fruits.
author: Jessica T.

description: its so nice to have snack before the night ends. and im glad that this place open til midnight! egg&spam with instant noodle is the best in this kind of cold weather!
author: ManGi X.

description: hmm..this is not my favorite cafe...came here in evening and it was not busy at all however, the service was super slow.. The dessert took forever to come out and the sago was watered down...........
author: Tiffany L.

description: Like I said in my review of 100% Healthy Dessert , since I've been working at a dessert place I've been paying more attention to desserts . I came here again twice a few weeks ago with my friend to try some new things . I got a pear juice which taste a little odd . I got the three colored peanut dumplings  which was WAY TOO SWEET . The B-kid Jellygrass was not sweet enough . The milk tea pudding tastes kind of bitter and odd . I also didn't like its texture .. it's mushy just like the mango pudding I ordered . The preserved pickle & sliced pork chow mein was WAY TOO SALTY . I decided to try the milk pudding because I've never had it before . It tasted very odd . Idk , maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste . The egg puffs were good though . Still like the ones at Eggette's more but the ones here are good too . This place has dropped two stars in my book . But since the owner or whoever was nice enough to read my review and tell me that he would improve things , I will give it an extra star . Also because I like the slogan for this place . Don't know what it is ? Next time you visit , read the back of the servers' shirts .
author: Eileen L.

description: The instant noodles here are nothing worth raving about, but the service was pretty good and so were the prices on the menu. It's a popular dessert destination in the Richmond area, so expect to wait a bit for a table when business peaks around 11pm.
author: Jason T.

description: late night snack place that could use a new name.  which cafe?  could try Creations instead.
author: Rob C.

description: not the number one choice for me to go eat dessert.. they only take cash.. dessert there is okay.. but great for teens and couples to spend time together... while eating dessert and watching chinese drama....
author: Lily T.

description: great late night cafe with tons to choose from. i usually get fried bananas with ice cream on the side = delicious! service is usually very good and the wait is usually not that long unless it is a weekend. on the nights when it is not as busy, this is a great place to get a bite to eat and just sit and hang out.
author: Vivian D.

description: My friend recommended this as opposed to 100% healthy desserts. The first time we went, we couldn't get any seats and was on the waiting list, but being impatient decided to skip. This weekend we returned, we didn't have to wait for a table, fantastic! The waitress was nice and friendly giving good suggestions for alternatives since they didn't have any of the milkshakes until 20 minutes later (20 minutes for a milkshake? that's ridiculous). I had the black sesame paste (delicious, not the best i've had, but it was good). My sister had the sesame rice noodles (peanut butter sauce?) was actually really tasty, wish the portion was bigger. The mango madness was yummy goodness (lots of mango, mango jelly, mango ice cream, real mango chunks). Now I only have to head back to try out all the other stuff on their rmenu.
author: Lily L.

description: this place is hecka good. i had a milkshake and the tong-but-luk and it was very good. the place's name applies to my decision. very nice and clean and busy and good service.
author: Cory Y.

description: many time, there are rhymes and reasons to decisions.  i am not sure why this place has such high rankings.  perhaps, it all depends on the person working there, what time, etc.  well, i happened to go one afternoon with my husband and brother, and decided to order the milk custard with fresh fruits.  it took a good 15 minutes before the waitress came to take our order (please keep in mind that there was only one other table, and they already got their food).  when my order came, i took a bite of the cantaloupe, and literally almost hurled.  the fruit not only smelled soured, the fruits were bad.  what place of business that serves food, does not check for quality?  obviously...not my favorite cafe.  so, they switched it out, and this time, i just asked for no fruits.  the dessert was just "eh."  now get this...my husband just ordered milk tea...took 45 minutes.  must have had to pluck the tea leaves, or something.  overall, my experience was less than stellar at this average dessert joint.
author: Jenny Y.
